dianoea: <entryFree id="n13732" type="greek" key="di^a^noea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭănœa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/noia</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n13732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by which a fact is exhibited instead of a conception</hi>, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Fig. 18, p. 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dianome: <entryFree id="n13733" type="greek" key="di^a^no^me"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭănŏme</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dianomh/</foreign>, <sense id="n13733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distribution of money</hi> (in canvassing for office), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 117 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diapanton: <entryFree id="n13734" type="gloss" key="di^a^panto_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăpantōn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ pa/ntwn</foreign>, <sense id="n13734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">universally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CORONATO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2627 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
diapasma: <entryFree id="n13735" type="greek" key="di^a^pasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăpasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o=ia/pasma</foreign>, <sense id="n13735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scented powder for sprinkling on any thing</hi>, <cb n="DIAT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 2, 3, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:125" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 73, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:88:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 88, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diapason: <entryFree id="n13736" type="greek" key="di^a^pa_so_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăpāsōn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ pasw=n</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">xordw=n</foreign>), in music, <sense id="n13736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the whole octave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> 2, 22, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 934 al.</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭătessărōn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">diatessa/rwn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a fourth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 8</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">disdĭăpāsōn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">di\s dia\ pasw=n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a double octave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 22, 20, § 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. diatonicus: <entryFree id="n13761" type="greek" key="di^a^to^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭătŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diatoniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diatonic</hi>, in music: modulatio, Mart. <cb n="DICA" /> Cap. 9, § 959; § 963.—</sense><sense id="n13761.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diatonicon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of masonry filled in with rubble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diatonus: <entryFree id="n13762" type="greek" key="di^a^to^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭătŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/tonos</foreign> (extended). <sense id="n13762.0" n="I" level="1"> In architecture: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres,</quote> <trans><tr>band-stones, which run through the thickness of a wall and bind it together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13762.1" n="II" level="1"> In music: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diatonum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the natural</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diatonic series of notes</hi> without breaks or intervals, <hi rend="ital">the diatonic scale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

diatritus: <entryFree id="n13767" type="greek" key="di^a_^tri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭā^trĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/tritos</foreign>, <sense id="n13767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the return of a fever on the third day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Cap.</author> 5, § 524 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diaula: <entryFree id="n13769" type="main" key="di^aula"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, Ap. Herb. 93.</sense></entryFree>
diaulos: <entryFree id="n13770" type="greek" key="di^aulos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaulos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/aulos</foreign>, <sense id="n13770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double course</hi> (in which the runner, after reaching the goal, ran the same distance back), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 173" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diaxylon: <entryFree id="n13771" type="main" key="di^axy^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaxylon</orth>, v. diacheton.</entryFree>
diazeugmenon: <entryFree id="n13772" type="greek" key="di^a^zeugme^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăzeugmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diazeu/gmenon</foreign>, in rhet., <sense id="n13772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation, disjunction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 536</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diazeuxis: <entryFree id="n13773" type="greek" key="di^a^zeuxis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăzeuxis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/zeucis</foreign>, rhet. t. t., = diaeresis, <sense id="n13773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, Prob. p. 1438 P.</sense></entryFree>
diazoma: <entryFree id="n13774" type="greek" key="di^a^zo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăzōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/zwma</foreign>, <sense id="n13774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space between the seats in a theatre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6, 7</bibl>; cf. balteus, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 2. d.</sense></entryFree>
dibalo: <entryFree id="n13775" type="hapax" key="di_ba_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-bālo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to bleat abroad</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make common</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemptible by clamor; to injure</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll. (R<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Com. v. 249" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. v. 249</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
dibaphus: <entryFree id="n13776" type="greek" key="di^ba^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭbăphus</orth>, <itype>a, um, or us, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/bafos</foreign>, <sense id="n13776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">double dyed</hi> (once with scarlet and then with purple): <cit><quote lang="la">purpura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 22, § 45</bibl>.—Because the Roman magistrates wore garments striped with purple, </sense><sense id="n13776.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <itype>dibaphus, i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> ( = <foreign lang="greek">h( di/bafos</foreign>, sc. <foreign lang="greek">e)sqh/s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the purple staterobe of a high magistrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curtius noster dibaphum cogitat, sed eum infector moratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 2</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
dibrachys: <entryFree id="n13777" type="greek" key="di_bra^chys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dībrăchys</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">di/braxus</foreign>, <sense id="n13777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical foot consisting of two short syllables, a dibrach</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 471</bibl> P.; Mar. Victor. p. 2486 ib. (pure Lat. bibrevis).</sense></entryFree>
dibucino: <entryFree id="n13778" type="gloss" key="di_bu_ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-būcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to trumpet forth</hi>, acc. to Vel. Long. p. 2227 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2294</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
dica: <entryFree id="n13779" type="greek" key="di^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/kh</foreign>, law t. t., <sense id="n13779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lawsuit, judicial process, action</hi>. Usually in the phrase dicam scribere (alicui) = <foreign lang="greek">di/khn gra/fein tini/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to bring an action</hi> against any one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 2, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:14:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 14, § 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 17, § 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; and stronger, impingere, <hi rend="ital">to bring a heavy action</hi> against one, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e lege Rupilia sortiri dicas oportere,</quote> <trans><tr>to select the jury by lot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dicabula: <entryFree id="n13780" type="main" key="di^ca_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcābŭla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcĭbŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dicax</etym>, <sense id="n13780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chatter, idle talk</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 809</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dicacitas: <entryFree id="n13781" type="main" key="di^ca_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">biting wit, raillery, banter</hi> (for syn. cf.: sal, facetiae, cavillatio, lepos, urbanitas): dicacitas sine dubio a dicendo, quod est omni generi commune, ducta est; <cit><quote lang="la">proprie tamen significat sermonem cum risu aliquos incessentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 218</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 60, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:29 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 29 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dicaculus: <entryFree id="n13782" type="main" key="di^ca_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcācŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n13782.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Talkative, loquacious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13782.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Facetious, witty</hi> (perh. only in Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">puella (with lepida), Ap. M. 2, p. 118, 2: sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 135, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcācŭlē</orth>,<pb n="570" /> <cb n="DICI" />  <hi rend="ital">keenly, satirically, facetiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerat probrum, Ap. M. 1, p. 106, 20: tractabat lurconem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 213, 6.</sense></entryFree>
dicaearchia: <entryFree id="n13783" type="main" key="Di^caearchi_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭcaearchī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the old name of</hi> Puteoli, now <hi rend="ital">Puzzuolo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 4</bibl> Müll.—Also called <itype>Dĭcarchis, ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120, 68</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Dicarchi moenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 2, 2, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13783.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n13783.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭcaearchi</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of that city.—Gen. plur.</hi> in Greek form, Dicaearcheum, Lucil. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=122:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 122, 14</bibl> Müll. (cf. Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 193 and 281).—</sense><sense id="n13783.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭcarchē-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Dicaearchia</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Puteoli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 2, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:385" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:535" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 535</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dicaearchus: <entryFree id="n13784" type="main" key="Di^caearchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭcaearchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dikai/arxos</foreign>. <sense id="n13784.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The founder of Dicaearchia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 2, 2, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13784.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pupil of Aristotle, a famous philosopher and geographer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:16 al" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dicaeologia: <entryFree id="n13785" type="greek" key="di^caeo^lo^gia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcaeŏlŏgia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dikaiologi/a</foreign>, a rhet. t. t., <sense id="n13785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plea, defence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:3, p. 81" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 3, p. 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dicarcheus: <entryFree id="n13786" type="main" key="Di^carche_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭcarchēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Dicaearchia, <sense id="n13786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</sense></entryFree>
dicarchis: <entryFree id="n13787" type="main" key="Di^carchis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭcarchis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Dicaearchia.</entryFree>
dicassit: <entryFree id="n13788" type="main" key="di^cassit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcassit</orth>, v. 1. dico <sense id="n13788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dicatio: <entryFree id="n13789" type="main" key="di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. dico, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 1.</etym>. <sense id="n13789.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A formal declaration of intention to become a citizen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11</bibl> (v. the passage in its connection).—</sense><sense id="n13789.1" n="II" level="1"> = praedicatio, <hi rend="ital">a praising</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13789.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 9, 3, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13789.3" n="B" level="2"> As a title: <cit><quote lang="la">tua dicatio,</quote> <trans><tr>your Reverence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 11, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; Lact. Mort. pers. 48 al.</sense></entryFree>
dicatus: <entryFree id="n13790" type="main" key="di^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. dico.</entryFree>
dicax: <entryFree id="n13791" type="main" key="di^cax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. dico</etym>, <sense id="n13791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking sharply, satirical, sarcastic, acute, witty</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Demosthenes non tam dicax fuit quam facetus. Est autem illud acrioris ingenii, hoc majoris artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with facetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl>; with venustus and urbanus, *Catull. 22, 2; with lascivus, Caelius in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with cavillator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Satyri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicax in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
dice: <entryFree id="n13792" type="main" key="di_ce^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīcĕ</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīcēbo</orth>, v. 2. dico <sense id="n13792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dichalcum: <entryFree id="n13793" type="greek" key="di^chalcum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭchalcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/xalkon</foreign>, <sense id="n13793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small coin, the fourth</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the fifth) part of an obolus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 34, 109, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dichomenion: <entryFree id="n13794" type="greek" key="di^cho^me_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭchŏmēnĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dixomh/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n13794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dichoneutus: <entryFree id="n13795" type="greek" key="di^cho_neutus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭchōneutus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dis-xw/neutos</foreign>, <sense id="n13795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">recast, adulterated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 11, 21, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dichoreus: <entryFree id="n13796" type="greek" key="di^cho^re_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭchŏrēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dixorei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n13796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double trochee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dichotomos: <entryFree id="n13797" type="greek" key="di^cho^to^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭchŏtŏmos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dixo/tomos</foreign>, <sense id="n13797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cut in two, halved</hi> (pure Lat. dimidiatus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>; Firm. Math. 4 praef.</sense></entryFree>
dichronus: <entryFree id="n13798" type="greek" key="di_^chro^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^chrŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/xronos</foreign>, <sense id="n13798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two quantities, common</hi> (pure Lat. anceps): vocales, Victor. p. 1966 P. al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 982</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dicibula: <entryFree id="n13799" type="main" key="di^ci^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcĭbŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. dicabula.</entryFree>
dicimonium: <entryFree id="n13800" type="main" key="di_ci^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīcĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. dīco</etym>, <sense id="n13800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking, oratory</hi>, an antiquated word acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 61</bibl> ex conj. Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dicio: <entryFree id="n13801" type="main" key="di^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ditio</orth>; occurs only in the <sense id="n13801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen., dat., acc.</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, and in <number>plur.</number> once, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 221</bibl>; so Hemsterhuis, Orat. p. 7.—Georges rejects the <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi>, but <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 514 sq.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root dic-; Sanscr. dicami, point out; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dei/knumi</foreign>; Lat. dico; cf.: condicio, judex</etym>, a t. t., milit. and polit., <hi rend="ital">dominion, sovereignty, authority, rule, sway, power</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13801.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Commagenem, dicionis regiae usque ad id tempus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenum quod inter Alpes Apenninumque agri sit, suae dicionis fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyros mare dicionis suae fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem dicioni ejus adjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subjecit dicioni suae hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicioni alicujus se permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:37:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:1 al" default="NO">8, 13, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem dicioni nostrae subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. under <cb n="DICO" /> <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">dedunt se, urbem et liberos In dicionem atque in arbitrium Thebano poplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 103</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in dicionem tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes eas civitates in dicionem potestatemque populi Romani esse redactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 19</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 16</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes multas sub imperium populi Romani dicionemque subjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilergetes in jus dicionemque recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub populi Romani imperium dicionemque cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntate concedere in dicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicionem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Dig. 1:2:2:section=32" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> Dig. 1, 2, 2, § 32</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitiam populi Romani dicionemque esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 66</bibl></cit> (cf. on the constr. esp. Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 3</bibl>).—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> (also very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">sub alicujus dicione atque imperio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 609</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes, quae in eorum regno ac dicione sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in parte magis quam in dicione alicujus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in servitute atque in dicione alicujus teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terras omni dicione tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 236</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicione premere aliquos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 737</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 54</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n13801.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond milit. and polit. life: <cit><quote lang="la">auris meas dedo in dicionem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam res publica, in paucorum potentium jus atque dicionem concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis gentis, etc. ... decemvirum dicioni, judicio potestatique permissa esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub dicione ejus magistratus (sc. censoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respirare contra nutum dicionemque alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in sua potestate ac dicione tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput liberum fidei suae commissum alienae dicioni subicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:19:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 19, 10</bibl></cit> (dub. al. condicioni).</sense></entryFree>
dicis: <entryFree id="n13802" type="main" key="dicis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dicis</orth>, <sense id="n13802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> [v. 2. dico], in the phrase dicis causa or gratia, orig. a jurid. t. t., meaning <hi rend="ital">for the sake of judicial form;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">for form's sake, for the sake of appearance</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">lo/gou xa/rin</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illis aliquid nummulorum dicis causa daret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 5</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicis gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1, 103 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 252</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13802.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Pontifici accidat dicis causa epulanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 16</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicis ergo = dicis causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 73</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
dico: <entryFree id="n13803" type="main" key="di^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (dixe for dixisse, Val. Ant. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; DICASSIT dixerit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=75:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 75, 15</bibl>; rather = dicaverit), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>orig. the same word with 2. dīco; cf. the meaning of abdĭco and abdīco, of indĭco and indīco, dedĭco, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A. al., Corss. Ausspr. 1, 380</etym>. <sense id="n13803.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To proclaim, make known</hi>. So perh. only in the foll. passage: pugnam, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 287, 30</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13803.1" n="II" level="1"> Relig. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to dedicate, consecrate, devote</hi> any thing to a deity or to a deified person (for syn. cf.: dedico, consecro, inauguro). </sense><sense id="n13803.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: et me dicabo atque animam devotabo hostibus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum tibi (sc. Jovi) dicatum atque promissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ara condita atque dicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit> (for which aram condidit dedicavitque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitolium, templum Jovis O. M.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:610" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubrum ex manubiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 26, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lychnuchum Apollini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas Olympiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 4, 9, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen Veneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 178</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cygni Apollini dicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13803.3" n="2" level="3"> With a personal object, <hi rend="ital">to consecrate, to deify</hi> (cf. dedico, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">Janus geminus a Numa dicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter numina dicatus Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13803.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the relig. sphere. </sense><sense id="n13803.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give up, set apart, appropriate</hi> a thing to any one: recita; <cit><quote lang="la">aurium operam tibi dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc totum diem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum studium meae laudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus (orationis) epidicticum gymnasiis et palaestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum Maecenati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 10, 57, § 177</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">librum laudibus ptisanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:75 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 15, § 75 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deïopeam) conubio jungam stabili propriamque dicabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. the same <cb n="DICO" /> verse, <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: se Remis in clientelam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alii civitati,</quote> <trans><tr>to become a free denizen of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: se in aliam civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—*</sense><sense id="n13803.6" n="2" level="3"> (I. q. dedico, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.) <hi rend="ital">To consecrate</hi> a thing by using it for the first time: <cit><quote lang="la">nova signa novamque aquilam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">devoted, consecrated, dedicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca Christo dedicatissima, August. Civ. Dei, 3, 31: CONSTANTINO AETERNO AVGVSTO ARRIVS DIOTIMVS ... N. M. Q. (i. e. numini majestatique) EIVS DICATISSIMVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1083</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13804" type="main" key="di_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praes.</hi> DEICO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4848</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> usu. dic; cf. duc, fac, fer, from duco, etc., DEICVNTO, and <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> DEIXSERINT, P. C. de Therm. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3673</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> dice, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=298:29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 298, 29</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bac. 4, 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 47 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> dicem = dicam, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 23</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 6</bibl> Müll.—Another form of the future is dicebo, Novius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507</bibl> (Com. v. 8 Rib.). —<hi rend="ital">Perf. sync.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 12</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 100</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 82</bibl>; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 22</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Perf. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixem = dixissem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Pseud. 1, 5, 84</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> dixe = dix isse, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 451:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 451, 16</bibl>; Arn. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sept. Sap. de Cleob. 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf. praes. pass.</hi> dicier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 32</bibl>; Vatin. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9 al.</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root DIC = <foreign lang="greek">*d*e*i*k</foreign> in <foreign lang="greek">dei/knumi</foreign>; lit., to show; cf. <foreign lang="greek">di/kh</foreign>, and Lat. dicis, ju-dex, dicio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to say, tell, mention, relate, affirm, declare, state; to mean, intend</hi> (for syn. cf.: for, loquor, verba facio, dicto, dictito, oro, inquam, aio, fabulor, concionor, pronuntio, praedico, recito, declamo, affirmo, assevero, contendo; also, nomino, voco, alloquor, designo, nuncupo; also, decerno, jubeo, statuo, etc.; cf. also, nego.—The person addressed is usually put in <case>dat.</case>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>: dicere ad aliquem, in eccl. Lat., stands for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)pei=n pro/s tina</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 34 al.</bibl>; cf. infra I. B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>).</sense><sense id="n13804.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13804.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruonis socium nae me esse volui dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">advenisse familiarem dicito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec uti sunt facta ero dicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 304</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signi dic quid est?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dixero mendacium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. vera dico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 238</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facto aut dicto adest opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dictu opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est dictu facilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpe dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indignis si male dicitur, bene dictum id esse dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, quem dixi,</quote> <trans><tr>whom I have mentioned, named</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 45</bibl></cit> et saep.: vel dicam = vel potius, <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuporem hominis vel dicam pecudis attendite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi placebat Pomponius maxime vel dicam minime displicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 207</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13804.3" n="b" level="4"> Dicitur, dicebatur, dictum est, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., it is said, related, maintained</hi>, etc.; or, <hi rend="ital">they say, affirm</hi>, etc.: de hoc (sc. Diodoro) Verri dicitur, habere eum, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is reported to Verres that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine causa dicitur, ad ea referri omnes nostras cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 18, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO">7, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:508" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 508</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titum multo apud patrem sermone orasse dicebatur, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac habitasse platea dictum'st Chrysidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pulsis hostibus dici posset, eos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46, 3</bibl></cit>. Cf. also: hoc, illud dicitur, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:177 al" default="NO">11, 3, 177 al.</bibl> —Esp. in histt. in reference to what has been previously related: <cit><quote lang="la">ut supra dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut ante dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 9, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:11" default="NO">5, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:2" default="NO">8, 6, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13804.4" n="c" level="4"> (See Zumpt, Gram. § 607.) Dicor, diceris, dicitur, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., it is said that I, thou, he</hi>, etc.; or, <hi rend="ital">they say that I, thou</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nos dicamur duo omnium dignissimi esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicar Princeps Aeolium carmen ad Italos Deduxisse modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 30, 10 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi socius esse diceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: aedes Demaenetus ubi <pb n="571" /> <cb n="DICO" /> dicitur habitare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Pisistratus) primus Homeri libros confusos antea sic disposuisse dicitur, ut nunc habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quot annos nata dicitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is nunc dicitur venturus peregre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit> et saep. In a double construction, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, and <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> b. and c.): petisse dicitur major Titius ... idque ab eis facile (sc. eum) impetrasse, Auct. B. Afr. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.5" n="d" level="4"> Dictum ac factum or dictum factum (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma e)/pos a(/ma e)/rgon</foreign>), in colloq. lang., <hi rend="ital">no sooner said than done, without delay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum ac factum reddidi,</quote> <trans><tr>it was "said and done" with me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto citius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 80</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto prope citius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13804.7" n="1" level="3"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n13804.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To assert, affirm</hi> a thing as certain (opp. nego): <cit><quote lang="la">quem esse negas, eundem esse dicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebant, ego negabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus creditum non sit negantibus, iisdem credatur dicentibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13804.9" n="b" level="4"> For dico with a negative, nego is used, q. v.; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 799; <cit><quote lang="la">but: dicere nihil esse pulchrius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 9, 3</bibl> Fabri; so, <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Liv. when the negation precedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 22, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 10, 13 al.</bibl>; cf. Krebs, Antibar. p. 355.—</sense><sense id="n13804.10" n="2" level="3"> dico is often inserted parenthetically, to give emphasis to an apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam C. Caesari, patri, dico adulescenti contigisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 83</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:197" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 58, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 15:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille mihi praesidium dederat, cum dico mihi, senatui dico populoque Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.11" n="3" level="3"> In rhetor. and jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">to pronounce, deliver, rehearse, speak</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n13804.12" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio dicta de scripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam de scripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:77" default="NO">9, 2, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prooemium ac narrationem et argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theses et communes locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:56:189" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 56, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam, of the defendant or his attorney,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a defensive speech, to plead in defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:3" default="NO">7, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:24 al" default="NO">8, 2, 24 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">causas (said of the attorney),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 32 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <trans><tr>to pronounce judgment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 14</bibl>; hence the praetor's formula: DO, DICO, ADDICO; v. do, etc.—</sense><sense id="n13804.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. pers., to plead before</hi> a person or tribunal: <cit><quote lang="la">ad unum judicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos? ad me, si idoneus videor qui judicem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:29:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 29, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. of thing, to speak in reference to, in reply to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non audeo ad ista dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.15" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec idem loqui, quod dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est oratoris proprium, apte, distincte, ornate dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de aliqua re pro aliquo, contra aliquem, etc., innumerable times in Cic. and Quint.: dixi, the t. t. at the end of a speech,</quote> <trans><tr>I have done</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Ascon. and Zumpt, a. h. 1.; <cit><quote lang="la">thus, dixerunt, the t. t. by which the praeco pronounced the speeches of the parties to be finished,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. Spald. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the judicial sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">causam nullam or causam haud dico,</quote> <trans><tr>I have no objection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.16" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To describe, relate, sing, celebrate</hi> in writing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi dicere laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laudes Phoebi et Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:76" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianam, Cynthium, Latonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alciden puerosque Ledae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestes, pugilemve equumve,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelidae stomachum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestrium naturas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 138</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus Augusti dicendis non defuere decora ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir neque silendus neque dicendus sine cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.17" n="b" level="4"> Of prophecies, <hi rend="ital">to predict, foretell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellicosis fata Quiritibus Hac lege dico, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes per carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (Delphi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13804.18" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pronounce, articulate</hi><cb n="DICO" />  a letter, syllable, word: Demosthenem scribit Phalereus, cum <hi rend="ital">Rho</hi> dicere nequiret, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:21 al" default="NO">1, 7, 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13804.19" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To call, to name</hi>: habitum quendam vitalem corporis esse, <hi rend="ital">harmoniam</hi> Graii quam dicunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 106</bibl>; cf.: Latine dicimus <hi rend="ital">elocutionem</hi>, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">fra/sin</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaoniamque omnem Trojano a Chaone dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ames dici pater atque princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor quondam tua dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 678</bibl></cit> et saep. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dici beatus ante obitum nemo debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.20" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To name, appoint</hi> one to an office: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules roget praetor vel dictatorem dicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 22</bibl> (thrice): <cit><quote lang="la">magistrum equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrum bibendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13804.21" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To appoint, set apart. fix upon, settle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam mea bona meis cognatis dicam, inter eos partiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotis paululum vicino suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 26" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam omnem suam doti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 35</bibl></cit>: quoniam inter nos nuptiae sunt dictae, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diem nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem operi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem exercitui ad conveniendum Pharas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 28</bibl>, and v. dies: <cit><quote lang="la">locum consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges victis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem tibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 137</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legem sibi,</quote> <trans><tr>to give sentence upon one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium muneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: prius data est, quam tibi dari dicta, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 28</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem Numida inermis, ut dictum erat, accedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.22" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To utter, express</hi>, esp. in phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">non dici potest, dici vix potest, etc.: non dici potest quam flagrem desiderio urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dici vix potest quanta sit vis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. ad Quir. 1, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:85" default="NO">11, 3, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.23" n="10" level="3"> (Mostly in colloq. lang.) Alicui, like our vulg. <hi rend="ital">to tell</hi> one so and so, for <hi rend="ital">to admonish, warn, threaten</hi> him: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebam, pater, tibi, ne matri consuleres male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Datam. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Datam. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 1</bibl>.—Esp. freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi (ego) dico,</quote> <trans><tr>I tell you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 62</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 33</bibl> Ruhnk.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 19, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 122</bibl>; so, dixi, <hi rend="ital">I have said it</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you may depend upon it, it shall be done</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.24" n="11" level="3"> Dicere sacramentum or sacramento, <hi rend="ital">to take an oath, to swear;</hi> v. sacramentum.</sense><sense id="n13804.25" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, i. q. intellego, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fhmi/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to mean</hi> so and so; it may sometimes be rendered in English by <hi rend="ital">namely, to wit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quemquam vidi, qui magis ea, quae timenda esse negaret, timeret, mortem dico et deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 174</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Sequar ut institui divinum illum virum, quem saepius fortasse laudo quam necesse est. <hi rend="ital">At.</hi> Platonem videlicet dicis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxoris dico, non tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something said</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a saying, a word</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13804.26" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: haut doctis dictis certantes sed male dictis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 274 Vahl.; acc. to Hertz.: nec maledictis); so, <cit><quote lang="la">istaec dicta dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 113</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">condocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferocibus dictis rem nobilitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob admissum foede dictumve superbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1224</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">facete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 24</bibl>;
