<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absurde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambigue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 449</bibl></cit> et saep.—Pleon.: <cit><quote lang="la">feci ego istaec dicta quae vos dicitis (sc. me fecisse),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Casin. 5, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13804.27" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13804.28" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A saying, maxim, proverb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">veridica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: Catonis est dictum. <hi rend="ital">Pedibus compensari pecuniam</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Hence, the title of a work by Caesar: Dicta collectanea (his <foreign lang="greek">*)apofqe/gmata</foreign>, mentioned in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n13804.29" n="2" level="3"> For facete dictum, <hi rend="ital">a witty saying, bon-mot</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (cf. <cb n="DICT" /> Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:16" default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:36" default="NO">36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 273</bibl> et saep.; cf. also, dicterium.—</sense><sense id="n13804.30" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Poetry, verse</hi> (abstr. and concr.): dicti studiosus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturam expandere dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ennius hirsuta cingat sua dicta corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 61.—</sense><sense id="n13804.31" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A prediction, prophecy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:326 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 326 al.</bibl>; cf. dictio.—</sense><sense id="n13804.32" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An order, command</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto paruit consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 815</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dicta dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25 al.</bibl>: dicto audientem esse and dicto audire alicui, v. audio.—</sense><sense id="n13804.33" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A promise, assurance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi dixerant sese dedituros ... Cares, tamen, non dicto capti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; Fur. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dicrotum: <entryFree id="n13805" type="greek" key="dicro^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dicrŏtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. navigium), = <foreign lang="greek">di/krotos</foreign> (two-oared), <sense id="n13805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a galley with two banks of oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">dicrŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. navis), Auct. B. Alex. 47, 2.</sense></entryFree>
dictabolarium: <entryFree id="n13806" type="main" key="dicta_bo^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictābŏlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dicto</etym>, i. q. dicterium, <sense id="n13806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a satirical saying</hi>, plur., Laber. ap. Fronto de Or. 1.</sense></entryFree>
dictaeus: <entryFree id="n13807" type="main" key="Dictaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Dicte, <sense id="n13807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.</sense></entryFree>
dictamen: <entryFree id="n13808" type="main" key="dicta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dicto</etym>, late Lat. for dictum, praescriptum, praeceptum.</entryFree>
dictamnum: <entryFree id="n13809" type="main" key="dictamnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictamnum</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Dicte, <sense id="n13809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</sense></entryFree>
dictata: <entryFree id="n13810" type="main" key="dicta_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n13810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lessons, exercises</hi>, etc., v. dicto <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dictatio: <entryFree id="n13811" type="main" key="dicta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dicto</etym>, <sense id="n13811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dictating, dictation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:4 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dictatiuncula: <entryFree id="n13812" type="hapax" key="dicta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dictatio</etym>, <sense id="n13812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short dictation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Vigil. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dictator: <entryFree id="n13813" type="main" key="dicta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dicto, qs. a commander</etym>. <sense id="n13813.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dictator</hi>, the chief magistrate in several Italian states, elected by the Romans in seasons of emergency for six months, and armed with absolute authority; <cit><quote lang="la">formerly called Magister populi, and also Praetor Maximus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; Lydus de Magistr. 1, 36-38 et saep.; cf. Mommsen, Hist. Book I. ch. 2; 1, p. 330 N. Y. ed. Anthon's Smith's Antiq. p. 360; Kreuz. Excurs. XII. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:page=509" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. p. 509</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">The chief magistrate of other cities of Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2293</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3786 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13813.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of Hannibal, as chief of the Carthaginians, Column. Rostr.; cf. Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13813.2" n="II" level="1"> Qui dictat, <hi rend="ital">one who dictates</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Ep. 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dictatorius: <entryFree id="n13814" type="main" key="dicta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dictator</etym>, <sense id="n13814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a dictator; dictatorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:44:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animadversio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the son of the dictator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dictatrix: <entryFree id="n13815" type="hapax" key="dicta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dictatress</hi>, comic., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dictatura: <entryFree id="n13816" type="main" key="dicta_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n13816.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The office of a dictator, dictatorship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 52</bibl> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n13816.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The work of dictating to pupils;</hi> only in a play upon the double meaning in the sentence: Sullam nescisse litteras, qui dictaturam deposuerit, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dicte: <entryFree id="n13817" type="main" key="Dicte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*di/kth</foreign>, <sense id="n13817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in the eastern part of Crete</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Sethia</hi>), <hi rend="ital">in a cave of which Jupiter, acc. to fable, was concealed from Saturn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 164</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13817.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv., </sense><sense id="n13817.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Dictaean</hi>, among poets for <hi rend="ital">Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 536</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>Minos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Telestes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dictaeae astra coronae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Ariadne</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 208</bibl></cit>: arundo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the Cretans</hi>, who were famous archers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:184" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 184</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pennae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:634" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 634</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13817.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dictamnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dic-tamnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the plant dittany</hi>, growing in great abundance on Mount Dicte and Mount Ida: Origanum dictamnus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:93" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 8, 53, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:142" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 412</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dicterium: <entryFree id="n13818" type="greek" key="dicte_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">deikth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n13818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a witty saying, a bon-mot</hi> (pure Lat. dictum). —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Pompcn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <pb n="572" /> <cb n="DICT" /> Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicteria dicere in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:44:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 44, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dicticos: <entryFree id="n13819" type="main" key="dicti^co^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictĭcŏs</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">deiktiko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n13819.0" n="I" level="1"> Gen., <hi rend="ital">pointing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus quem Graeci dicticon vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13819.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">demonstrative</hi>: enthymema, Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 11.</sense></entryFree>
dictio: <entryFree id="n13820" type="main" key="dicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. dico</etym>, <sense id="n13820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saying, speaking, uttering, delivery</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13820.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n13820.2" n="A" level="2"> (Good prose, for the most part only in jurid. and rhetor. lang.) Sententiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4</bibl>: testimonii, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the right of giving testimony</hi>, *<bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <trans><tr>a defending, pleading</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 10, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae ovium et boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13820.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Kinds of delivery, style, diction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seposuisse a ceteris dictionibus eam partem dicendi, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oratoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 152</bibl></cit>: et vero fuit in hoc (Crasso) popularis dictio excellens; <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii genus dicendi multo aptius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:165" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 44, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extemporales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discipulorum,</quote> <trans><tr>declamation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeptuosa dictione, opp. aperte dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Com. Frag. v. 5" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Com. Frag. v. 5</bibl></cit> Rib.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n13820.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The use of a word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">phrase, a mode of expression</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4" default="NO">9, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:3:5" default="NO">11, 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13820.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A word</hi>, = verbum, vocabulum (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> II. p. 51, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13820.6" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n13820.7" n="A" level="2"> (Cf. dictum, B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">An oracular response, prediction</hi> (rare; not in Cic.): flexa, non falsa autumare dictio Delphis solet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 237, 4</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. v. 308</bibl>); Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13820.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The art of speaking, oratory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictioni operam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dictiosus: <entryFree id="n13821" type="gloss" key="dicti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dictum</etym>, perhaps <sense id="n13821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">facetious, satirical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 61</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dictito: <entryFree id="n13822" type="main" key="dicti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [dicto], <hi rend="ital">to say often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">emphatically; to declare, maintain, assert repeatedly</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n13822.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">non, obsecro, es, quem semper te esse dictitasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ita dictitat, iis esse metuendum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 1, 8: ut Lacedaemonii suos omnes agros esse dictitarint, quos spiculo possent attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: Caelius profectus, ut dictitabat, ad Caesarem pervenit, <hi rend="ital">as he alleged</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 22, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32, 4</bibl> and 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl> Kritz.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male dictitatur tibi volgo in sermonibus,</quote> <trans><tr>there are bad rumors about you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13822.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">causas,</quote> <trans><tr>to plead frequently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dicto: <entryFree id="n13823" type="main" key="dicto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dicto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>2. dico</etym>, <sense id="n13823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to say often; to pronounce, declare</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">assert repeatedly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13823.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rogarem te, ut diceres pro me tu idem, qui illis orationem dictavisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercemur servum qui dictet nomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n13823.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13823.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dictate</hi> to one for writing: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non modo Tironi dictare, sed ne ipse quidem audere scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 13</bibl> b. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 2, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:18" default="NO">10, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 49</bibl> et saep. So of the dictating of teachers (common for want of books): <cit><quote lang="la">memini quae mihi parvo Orbilium dictare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sat. 1, 10, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13823.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> As the practice of dictating came, in the course of time, to be very general (v. Gesner upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 18</bibl>), dictare, since the Aug. per., acquired the signif. <hi rend="ital">to express in written language, make, compose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ducentos versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: carmina (for which, shortly before and after, <hi rend="ital">scribere</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">codicillos,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw up, make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also, summas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dispose of by will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:95" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 95</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non unus tibi rivalis dictabitur heres,</quote> <trans><tr>appointed, designated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:218" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 218</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">actionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw up a declaration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and among jurists in gen.,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring an action, go to law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:50" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:9:3 al" default="NO">49, 9, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13823.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To prescribe, recommend, order, dictate</hi> (cf. 2. dico, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 10; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense the primitive of dictator, although no ante-Aug. examples occur): sportulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: dictataque jurant <cb n="DIDO" /> Sacramenta deis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:448" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 448</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13823.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ita videtur ratio dictare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, § 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus sordet omne, quod natura dictavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 26; so with <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:6" default="NO">2, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dictāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.). </sense><sense id="n13823.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Things dictated</hi> by the master to his scholars, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lessons, exercises, rules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:29 al" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 29 al.</bibl>—Also, in gen., </sense><sense id="n13823.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Precepts, rules</hi>, e. g. for gladiators, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for mimes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dictor: <entryFree id="n13824" type="main" key="dictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. dico</etym>, <sense id="n13824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who says</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">a speaker</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 4:19 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 4, 19 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dictum: <entryFree id="n13825" type="main" key="dictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. dico, II.</entryFree>
dicturio: <entryFree id="n13826" type="main" key="dictu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n13826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. a., to long to say</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tell</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortiter a se facta semper dicturiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dictus: <entryFree id="n13827" type="main" key="dictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 2. dico.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13828" type="hapax" key="dictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. dico</etym>, <sense id="n13828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saying, speech</hi>, Aur. Vict. epit. 14.</sense></entryFree>
dictynna: <entryFree id="n13829" type="main" key="Dictynna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictynna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*di/ktunna</foreign>. <sense id="n13829.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The nymph Britomartis, so called because, when pursued by Minos</hi>, she sprang into a net (<foreign lang="greek">di/ktuon</foreign>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Callim. Hymn. Dian. 189 sq.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13829.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An appellation of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 441</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 619</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:755" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 755</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:632" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 632</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13829.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictynnaeum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nēum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place sacred to the goddess Dictynna, near Sparta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 38, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13829.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictynnaeus</orth> <itype>mons</itype> (<foreign lang="greek">to\ *diktu/nnaion</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a promontory on the N. W. coast of Crete, where a temple of Diana stood, now Cape Sparta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13829.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city near the temple of Diana in Crete</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dictys: <entryFree id="n13830" type="main" key="Dictys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dictys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*di/ktus</foreign>. <sense id="n13830.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mariner changed by Bacchus into a dolphin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 615</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13830.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A centaur, slain at the wedding of Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:334 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 334 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13830.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fisherman on the island of Seriphos, who saved Perseus from drowning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13830.3" n="IV" level="1"> Dictys Cretensis, <hi rend="ital">the traditional author of a mythical history of the Trojan war, in Greek; preserved to us in the Latin translation of L. Septimius</hi>, v. Teuffel, Roem. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 416, 1-4.</sense></entryFree>
didascalicus: <entryFree id="n13831" type="greek" key="di^dasca^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭdascălĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">didaskaliko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to instruction, didactic</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opusculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdascălica</orth>, <itype>ōn or ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Attius</hi>, in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:11:4 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 11, 4 al.</bibl>; cf. Madvig Opuscc. Acadd. prior. pp. 87-110.</sense></entryFree>
diditus: <entryFree id="n13832" type="main" key="di_di^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. dido.</entryFree>
didius: <entryFree id="n13833" type="main" key="Di_di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman plebeian</hi> gens; so T. Didius, <hi rend="ital">consul in the year</hi> 656 a. u. c., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:568 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 568 al.</bibl>; Didius Julianus, <hi rend="ital">emperor of Rome in the year</hi> 193 A. D., whose life is written by Spartianus.—</sense><sense id="n13833.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lex Didia sumptuaria, of the year 610 a. u. c.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13, 6</bibl></cit>. Another law: <cit><quote lang="la">Lex Caecilia Didia, of the year 656,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dido: <entryFree id="n13834" type="main" key="di_do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-do</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">disdo</orth>; <sense id="n13834.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), didĭdi, didĭtum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to give out, spread abroad, disseminate, distribute</hi> (anteclass. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; esp. in Lucr.; once in Tac.). </sense><sense id="n13834.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: numquam ego argentum ... disdidi, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:2, p. 150" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 2, p. 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in venas cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:956" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 956</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:947" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 947</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 703</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:633" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 633</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne per caules palati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 623</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 269</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1166" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1166</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: dide, disice, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 16, 37</bibl> (Com. Frag. v. 239 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n13834.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum munia didit (sc. servis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per magnas didita gentes Solatia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor per agmina Trojana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua terris didita fama,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 132</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fama in populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:186" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama per provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13835" type="main" key="Di_do_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīdō</orth>, <itype>ūs and ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*didw/</foreign>, <sense id="n13835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated foundress of Carthage, daughter of the Tyrian king Belus, wife of Sichaeus, and sister of Pygmalion;</hi> called also <hi rend="ital">Elisa</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Elissa.—Nom.</hi> Dido, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 299</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">340</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">360</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:545" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 545</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">640</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Dīdōnis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 4, 3, 6 al.</bibl>: Dīdūs, Cornutus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 102</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> Dīdō, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 5, 2, 14</bibl> (dub. al. Didoni): <cit><quote lang="la">Dīdōni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Dīdō, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 383</bibl>; <cb n="DIDY" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">133</bibl> (in both passages several MSS. read Didon); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Didonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Trig. Tyr. 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Conf. 1, 13</bibl>: Dīdūn, Atteius ap. Charis. l. l.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Dīdōne, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 685</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 223</bibl> (cf. Neue Formenl. 1, 352).</sense></entryFree>
didrachmon: <entryFree id="n13836" type="greek" key="di_^dra_chmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^drāchmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^drāchma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">didraxmon</foreign>, <sense id="n13836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double drachma</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 17, 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diduco: <entryFree id="n13837" type="main" key="di_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to draw apart; to part, split, separate, sever, sunder, divide</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13837.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13837.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus eas (sc. nubes) leviter diducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum compresserat digitos pugnumque fecerat ... cum autem diduxerat et manum dilataverat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the graceful movements of the arms in dancing: molli diducit candida gestu brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 5</bibl></cit> (Müll. al. deducit): <cit><quote lang="la">candida seu molli diducit brachia motu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilium volnere diductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem et crus in diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares, Quint 11, 3, 80: labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces immani hiatu,</quote> <trans><tr>to stretch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:194" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rictum risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 560</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">complexus vestros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 588</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arva et urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulos (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 153</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of natural cleavings of the earth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 69</bibl>: cibum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to digest</hi> = digerere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixti neque inter se diducti colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudam materiam in corpus omne diduci, Cels. praef.: maxima flumina in rivos diducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domum in multos diductam recessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13837.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi> the forces, in a good or (more freq.) in a bad sense; <hi rend="ital">to divide, distribute; to disperse, scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diductis nostris paullatim navibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instruunt aciem diductam in cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38, 1</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diducta propere in cornua levis armatura est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 55, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diductis in latera viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 2:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 6, 4: copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:111:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 111, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 584</bibl></cit> Cort.; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">choros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Crassus animadvertit, suas copias propter exiguitatem non facile diduci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3</bibl>. 40, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:7:31" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 7, 31</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13837.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum diducaris ab eo, quicum libentissime vixeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias cohaerentes, Sen. de Ira, 2, 29: nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">si repudio diducta fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diducta civitas ut civili bello,</quote> <trans><tr>divided into parties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">below: in sterili jejunaque materia, eandem speciem laudis diducere ac spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:12" default="NO">5, 13, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">litem domini et conductoris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to settle, adjust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assem in partes centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tres partes medicina diducta est, Cels. praef.: haec omnia rursus in species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:94 al" default="NO">94 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisionem in digitos,</quote> <trans><tr>to tell off on one's fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 24</bibl></cit> (coupled with partiri); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum in tam multiplex officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:20:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultio senatum in studia diduxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seditio in diversa consilia diduxerat vulgum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>; of classification, <hi rend="ital">to divide</hi>: in tres partes medicinam, Cels. praef.</sense></entryFree>
diductio: <entryFree id="n13838" type="main" key="di_ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diduco</etym>, <sense id="n13838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an expanding, separating</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Seneca): ostendit intentionem spiritus velocitas ejus et diductio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diductione rerum,</quote> <trans><tr>in dividing, separating the elements</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 3:13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diductus: <entryFree id="n13839" type="main" key="di_ductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from diduco.</entryFree>
didymae: <entryFree id="n13840" type="main" key="Di^dy^mae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdymae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n13840.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A group of islands on the coast of Troas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13840.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Islands on the coast of Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 131</bibl>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 469</bibl>, the better reading is Didyme.)</sense></entryFree>
didymaeus: <entryFree id="n13841" type="main" key="Di^dy^maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdymaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> of Didyma, <sense id="n13841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Ionia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum Didymaei Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 1, 17, 64</bibl>, and v. Didyme, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III. <pb n="573" /> <cb n="DIES" /></sense></entryFree>
didymaon: <entryFree id="n13842" type="main" key="Di^dy^ma_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdymāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a skilful artificer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 359</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
didyme: <entryFree id="n13843" type="main" key="Di^dy^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdymē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n13843.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 475</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13843.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island in the Aegaean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 469</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13843.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Ionia</hi> (also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdyma</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">*di/duma</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">in the Milesian territory, now Jeronda</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Joran, with a temple and oracle of Apollo</hi>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdy-mēon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*didumei=on</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 28</bibl>; cf. Mütz. and Zumpt, ad h. l.—Hence also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭdymeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*didumeu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Didymean</hi>, i. e. Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diechidnon: <entryFree id="n13844" type="greek" key="di^e^chi_^dno_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭĕchī^dnōn</orth> <foreign lang="greek">di) e)xidnw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n13844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">sub fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diecula: <entryFree id="n13845" type="main" key="di^e_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dies</etym>, <sense id="n13845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the short space of a day, one little day, a little while</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl>; and repeatedly in Ap.; so Met. 1, p. 106; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dierectus: <entryFree id="n13846" type="main" key="die_rectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-ērectus</orth> (in Plaut. always trisyllabic), a <itype>um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> <etym>erigo</etym>, qs. stretched out and raised on high, i. e. <sense id="n13846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crucified</hi> (only in Plautus and Varro; not in Terence), an abusive expression, like the English <hi rend="ital">Go and be hanged! gallowsbird</hi>, etc. (cf. furcifer, and v. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 457</bibl>; Lorence ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 837</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">i hinc dierectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abin dierectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recede hinc dierecte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi dierecte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">i dierecte in maxumam malam crucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i dierectum, cor meum, ac suspende te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi hinc dierecte. Abin hinc in malam crucem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu i dierecta cum sucula et cum porculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13846.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducit lembum jam dierectum navis praedatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lien dierectu'st,</quote> <trans><tr>is gone to the crows, is destroyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: apage in dierectum a domo nostra istam insanitatem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 49, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dies: <entryFree id="n13847" type="main" key="di^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭes</orth> (dīes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0094,001:Fragm. Odys. 7" default="NO"><author>Liv. Andron.</author> Fragm. Odys. 7</bibl>), ēi ([etilde]ī, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 35</bibl> et saep.; <sense id="n13847.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">dissyl.: di-ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> dies, die, and dii—dies, as in acies, facies, pernicies, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14</bibl>; Ann. v. 401 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl> ap. Gell. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 780</bibl></cit> P.; even in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 208</bibl>, where Gellius reads dies, v. Wagner ad loc., nearly all MSS. have die; cf. Rib. and Forbig. ad loc.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 17</bibl>; cf. Oud. ad B. G. 2, 23, 1. Die appears to be certain in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:97:3" default="NO" valid="yes">97, 3</bibl>. Also in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl>, Gellius reads dies, where our MSS., except the Cod. Lamb., have diei; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. those words do not belong to Cicero himself. Form dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 636</bibl></cit>, Rib. and Forbig. after Serv. and Gell. l. l.— <hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi>, diēī, saep. die, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 120</bibl>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">once dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1</bibl></cit>, Prol. 13; cf. Roby, Gram. 1, 121 sq.); <gen>m.</gen> (in sing. sometimes <gen>f.</gen>, esp. in the signif. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 1.) [root Sanscr. dī, gleam: dinas, day; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di=os</foreign>, heavenly; cf. Lat. Jovis (Diovis), Diana, deus, dīvus, etc. Old form, dius (for divus); cf.: nudius, diu, etc. The word also appears in composition in many particles, as pridem, hodie, diu, etc., v. Corss. Auspr. 2, 855 sq.], <hi rend="ital">a day</hi> (cf.: tempus, tempestas, aetas, aevum, spatium, intervallum).</sense><sense id="n13847.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13847.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the civil day</hi> of twenty-four hours. </sense><sense id="n13847.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies primus est veris in Aquario ... dies tertius ... dies civiles nostros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 77, 79, § 188</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2</bibl>: REBVS IVRE IVDICATIS TRIGINTA DIES IVSTI SVNTO, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; and 15, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; for which; <cit><quote lang="la">per dies continuos XXX., etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:78" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 78</bibl></cit>: multa dies in bello conficit unus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 297 ed. Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non uno absolvam die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ille est dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante hunc diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illo die impransus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 4, 11, 4; 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; 3, 6, 3 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cb n="DIES" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">diem scito esse nullum, quo die non dicam pro reo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi sedet totos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos dies ibi morati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies continuos XXX. sub bruma esse noctem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosce aliquot dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 71</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">festo die si quid prodegeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">festus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 26</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n13847.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (freq. in poetry metri gratiā; rare in prose), postrema, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ademit Una dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 912</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:921" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 921</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 96</bibl> and 998: homines, qui ex media nocte ad proximam mediam noctem in his horis XXIV. nati sunt, una die nati dicuntur, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl> (uno die, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus effectis armatisque diebus XXX., a qua die materia caesa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varronem profiteri, se altera die ad colloquium venturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly before: quo cum esset postero die ventum); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postera die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 2</bibl></cit> (for which, in the same author, more freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">postero die): pulchra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suprema,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:868" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 868</bibl></cit> et saep.—(But <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37, 1</bibl>, read altero, tertio.)—</sense><sense id="n13847.5" n="b" level="4"> Connections: <cit><quote lang="la">postridie ejus diei, a favorite expression of Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: 1, 47, 2; 1, 48, 2 et saep., v. postridie; <cit><quote lang="la">and cf.: post diem tertium ejus diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; Sulpic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ex die exspectabam,</quote> <trans><tr>from day to day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diem ex die ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; for which also: diem <hi rend="ital">de</hi> die prospectans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 48</bibl>; and: diem <hi rend="ital">de</hi> die differre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25</bibl>: LIBRAS FARRIS ENDO DIES DATO, <hi rend="ital">for every day, day by day, daily</hi>, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">affatim est hominum, in dies qui singulas escas edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in dies,</quote> <trans><tr>every day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 16, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl> Drak.; 34, 11 al.; less freq. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil usquam sui videt: in diem rapto vivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutabilibus in diem causis (opp. natura perpetua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 29</bibl></cit> (in another signif. <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A. 3); and: cui licet in diem ( = singulis diebus, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi>) dixisse Vixi, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 29, 42</bibl>. And still more rarely: ad diem, Treb. Gallien. 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante diem, v. ante.—Die = quotidie or in diem,</quote> <trans><tr>daily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos mille die victor sub Tartara misi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucissimos die composuisse versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 22</bibl></cit>: die crastini, noni, pristini, quinti, for die crastino, nono, etc., v. h. vv. crastinus, nonus, etc.; and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13847.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A set day, appointed time, term</hi> in the widest sense of the word (for appearing before court, in the army, making a payment, etc.). </sense><sense id="n13847.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>: MORBVS SONTICVS ... STATVS DIES CVM HOSTE ... QVID HORVM FVIT VNVM IVDICI ARBITROVE REOVE DIES DIFFISVS ESTO, XII.
