Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273, 26</bibl> Müll.; for which: STATVS CONDICTVSVE DIES CVM HOSTE, acc. to Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with comic reference to the words of this law,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit> (found also in <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">and freq.: status dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 16</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic nuptiis dictus est dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies colloquio dictus est ex eo die quintus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dictus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis certum diem conveniendi dicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 57, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">die certo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">constituto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretus colloquio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 113:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestitutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefinitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascriptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam advesperascit, dabis diem nobis aliquem, ut contra ista dicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 109:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 109, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 35</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies ater,</quote> <trans><tr>an unlucky day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (so commonly in this sense in class. prose, but only in <number>sing.</number>, v. Mützell ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut quasi dies si dicta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edicta ad conveniendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">constituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 3</bibl>: certa eius rei constituta,<cb n="DIES" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 33, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacta et constituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30:4:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30, 4, 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">annua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">die caecā emere, oculatā vendere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to buy on credit and sell for cash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>, v. caecus, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dies summa hodie est, mea amica sitne libera, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puto fore istam etiam a praecone diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ea dies venit (preceded by tempore ejus rei constituto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita die, qua suorum auxilia exspectaverant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 77, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in lege, quam ad diem proscriptiones fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 128</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13847.10" n="(g)" level="5"> Both genders together: <cit><quote lang="la">diem dicunt, qua die ad ripam Rhodani omnes conveniant: is dies erat a. d. V. Kal. Apr., etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 35 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13847.11" n="b" level="4"> Hence: dicere diem alicui, <hi rend="ital">to impeach, lay an accusation against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem mihi, credo, dixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitium Silano diem dixisse scimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caec. 20:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caec. 20, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A natural day, a day</hi>, as opp. to night: ut vel, quia est aliquid, aliud non sit, ut <hi rend="ital">Dies est, nox non est;</hi> vel, quia est aliquid, et aliud sit: <hi rend="ital">Sol est super terram, dies est</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 7</bibl>: pro di immortales, quis hic illuxit dies, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">credibile non est, quantum scribam die, quin etiam noctibus,</quote> <trans><tr>in the daytime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Att. 13:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat ullum esse cibum tam gravem, quin is die et nocte concoquatur,</quote> <trans><tr>in a single day and night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:N. D. 2:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in this signif.: die ac nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte et die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: currus rogat ille paternos, Inque diem alipedum jus et moderamen equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 48</bibl></cit>; and, connected with <hi rend="ital">nox</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Themistocles) diem noctemque procul ab insula in salo navem tenuit in ancoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—But more freq.: diem noctemque, like our <hi rend="ital">day and night</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">without ceasing, uninterruptedly;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 42</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 62</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which less freq.: diem et noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Hisp. 38:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Hisp. 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">diem ac noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4</bibl></cit> and 45: <cit><quote lang="la">noctemque diemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 94</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuate nocte ac die itinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 36, 8</bibl>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies noctesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 4</bibl> et saep.; also, reversing the order: noctesque diesque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 338 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctesque et dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes atque dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:127 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 127 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes diesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes ac dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes et dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:308" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 25</bibl> and 39; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 49</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: neque noctem neque diem intermittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli dies ... sic observant, ut noctem dies subsequatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit> Herz ad loc. So, too, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nocte dieque frequentat Limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:58:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 58, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum die,</quote> <trans><tr>at break of day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orto die ( = orta luce),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante diem ( = ante lucem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies fit, late Lat. for lucescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:22:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 22, 66</bibl></cit>: de die, <hi rend="ital">in open day, broad day;</hi> v. de.—</sense><sense id="n13847.13" n="3" level="3"> Dies alicujus (like the Heb. <foreign />; v. Gesen. Lex. s. h. v.). </sense><sense id="n13847.14" n="a" level="4"> I. q. dies natalis, <hi rend="ital">a birthday</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem meum scis esse III. Non. Jan. Aderis igitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 42, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in full: natali die tuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 5</bibl></cit> al. So the anniversary day of the foundation of a city is, dies natalis urbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.15" n="b" level="4"> I. q. dies mortis, <hi rend="ital">dying-day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandocumque fatalis et meus dies veniet statuarque tumulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Called, also: supremus dies. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supremus vitae dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 61</bibl>. Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">diem suum obire,</quote> <trans><tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> in Cic. Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the same sense: obire diem supremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dion. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exigere diem supremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explere supremum diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; 3, 76; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply: obire diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 109, 112, § 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gr. 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: fungi diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.16" n="c" level="4"> I. q. dies febris, <hi rend="ital">fever-day</hi>: etsi Non. Mart., <pb n="574" /> <cb n="DIES" /> die tuo, ut opinor, exspectabam epistolam a te longiorem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 8, 2 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n13847.17" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13847.18" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (from <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. A.). </sense><sense id="n13847.19" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A day</hi>, for that which is done in it (cf. the Hebr. <foreign />, the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)leu/qeron h)=mar</foreign>, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">is dies honestissimus nobis fuerat in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam dirus ille dies Sullanus C. Mario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Romanos daturos illius diei poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dies et Romanis refecit animos et Persea perculit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 67</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:35" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 35</bibl> Ruhnk.; 2, 86; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:58" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 58</bibl> Duker.: <cit><quote lang="la">imponite quinquaginta annis magnum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pulchrius hac consuetudine excutiendi totum diem? ... totum diem mecum scrutor, facta ac dicta mea remetior, etc., Sen. de Ira, 3, 36: dies Alliensis, i. q. pugna Alliensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cannensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:35 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 35 al.</bibl></cit> And so even of one's state of mind on any particular day: <cit><quote lang="la">qualem diem Tiberius induisset,</quote> <trans><tr>what humor, temper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13847.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A day's journey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc regionem, dierum plus triginta in longitudinem, decem inter duo maria in latitudinem patentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:14 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13847.21" n="3" level="3"> In gen. (like <foreign />, <foreign lang="greek">h(me/ra</foreign>, and our <hi rend="ital">day</hi>, for) <hi rend="ital">time, space of time, period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem tempusque forsitan ipsum leniturum iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 50</bibl>: amorem intercapedine ipse lenivit dies, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 522, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in the masc. gender: longus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:638" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 638</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 139</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also longa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">perexigua,</quote> <trans><tr>a brief respite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:372 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 372 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ea die ad hanc diem quae fecisti, in judicium voco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut infringatur hominum improbitas ipsa die, quae debilitat cogitationes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53 al.</bibl>: indutiae inde, non pax facta; <cit><quote lang="la">quarum et dies exierat, et ante diem rebellaverant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the term of the truce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (for which: quia <hi rend="ital">tempus</hi> indutiarum cum Veienti populo exierat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 58</bibl>).—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dies adimit aegritudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: dies festus, <hi rend="ital">festival-time, festival</hi>:—diem festum Dianae per triduum agi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 23</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">die lanam et agnos vendat,</quote> <trans><tr>at the right time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:150:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 150, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesens quod fuerat malum, in diem abiit,</quote> <trans><tr>to a future time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; so in diem, opp. statim, Q. Cic. Pet. cons. 12, 48; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24</bibl>.—Esp. freq. in diem vivere, <hi rend="ital">to live on from day to day, regardless of the future</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 4</bibl> et saep; cf. the equivoque with de die, under de.—</sense><sense id="n13847.22" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2—<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n13847.23" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Light of day, daylight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contraque diem radiosque micantes Obliquantem oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 411</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 444</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 602</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis mensibus non cernitur dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 2 al.</bibl>; also of the <hi rend="ital">eyesight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:237" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 237</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and trop. of the conscience: saeva dies animi scelerumque in pectore Dirae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.24" n="2" level="3"> For caelum, <hi rend="ital">the sky, the heavens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub quocumque die, quocumque est sidere mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendere diem nubes oriente remotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:201" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 201</bibl>.—Hence, like caelum, </sense><sense id="n13847.25" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The weather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totumque per annum Durat aprica dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:845" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.26" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrique volumina fumi Infecere diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio flatu violare diem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13847.27" n="III" level="1"> Dies personified. </sense><sense id="n13847.28" n="A" level="2"> I. q. <hi rend="ital">Sol</hi>, opp. Luna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">coupled with Mensis and Annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13847.29" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">fem., the daughter of Chaos, and mother of Heaven and Earth</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.; <hi rend="ital">of the first Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diesis: <entryFree id="n13848" type="greek" key="di^e^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/esis</foreign>. In ancient music, <sense id="n13848.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A quarter-tone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13848.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The first audible tone of an instrument</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diespiter: <entryFree id="n13849" type="main" key="Di^espi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭespĭter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Dies, Sanscr. Divas, L. divus; cf. ho-dier-nus, and <foreign lang="greek">path/r</foreign>, pater; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 233; 2, 458</etym>, another name for <sense id="n13849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Juppiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 66</bibl> and 9, § 75 and 77 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 1</bibl>; id. <cb n="DIFF" /> Poen. 3, 4, 29; 4, 2, 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 93</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Pluto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dieteris: <entryFree id="n13850" type="main" key="di^e^te_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭĕtēris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diethri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period of two years</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diezeugmenon: <entryFree id="n13851" type="greek" key="di^ezeugme^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭezeugmĕnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diezeugme/non</foreign>, rhet. t. t. (pure Lat. disjunctum), <sense id="n13851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation of equal circumstances</hi>, Aquil. Rom. de Fig. 43, p. 187.—</sense><sense id="n13851.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, musical t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/xorda diezeugme/na</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">two tetrachords, forming a scale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffamatio: <entryFree id="n13852" type="main" key="diffa_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diffamo</etym>, <sense id="n13852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a publishing, promulgation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 3:31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 3, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffamia: <entryFree id="n13853" type="main" key="diffa_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffāmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dis-fama</etym>, <sense id="n13853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">defamation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 3:31 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 3, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diffamo: <entryFree id="n13854" type="main" key="diffa_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fama</etym>, <sense id="n13854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread abroad by an ill report; to publish, divulge</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13854.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare and not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vulgat adulterium diffamatumque parenti Indicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 236</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen pessimum super virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 22, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13854.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decry, defame, malign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros feminasque procacibus scriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem probroso carmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: aliquem probris, Ap. M. 1, p. 107; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 31</bibl>.— With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: diffamat, incendio repentino domum suam possideri, Ap. M. 4, p. 147.—</sense><sense id="n13854.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To declare, make known, proclaim widely</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus diffamatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Morib. Eccl. 14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Morib. Eccl. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 1, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffarreatio: <entryFree id="n13855" type="main" key="diffarre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffarrĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient form of Roman divorce</hi> (cf.: remancipatio, divortium, repudium): genus sacrificii, quo inter virum et mulierem fiebat dissolutio. Dicta <hi rend="ital">diffarreatio</hi>, quia fiebat farreo libo adhibito, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 13</bibl> Müll. (opp. confarreatio); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2648</bibl>; v. confarreatio.</sense></entryFree>
diffensus: <entryFree id="n13856" type="main" key="diffensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [dis- FENDO = ferio, trudo], <sense id="n13856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deferred, protracted</hi>: dilatus, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273, 26</bibl> Müll. (for which others read diffisus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2, § 3</bibl>, and v. diffindo, II. B.).</sense></entryFree>
differens: <entryFree id="n13857" type="main" key="diffe^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĕrens</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĕrenter</orth>, v. <itype>differo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
differentia: <entryFree id="n13858" type="main" key="diffe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>differo</etym>, <sense id="n13858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a difference, diversity</hi> (cf.: discrepantia, distantia, discrimen, diversitas, variatio—good prose, esp. freq. in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n13858.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesti et decori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 84, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum, locorum temporumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri Graecique sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 146</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13858.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta differentia est in principiis naturalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:37" default="NO">3, 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:48" default="NO">7, 2, 48</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13858.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut facies infinitam habet differentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13858.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">a species</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus est notio ad pluris differentias pertinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">definitionem omnem ex genere et differentia consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
differitas: <entryFree id="n13859" type="main" key="diffe^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (ante- and postclass.; <sense id="n13859.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">v. the preceding art.),</quote> <trans><tr>a difference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 636</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 233.</sense></entryFree>
differo: <entryFree id="n13860" type="main" key="diffe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fĕro</orth>, <itype>distŭli, dīlātum, differre</itype> (<sense id="n13860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> differrier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1088" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1088</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">In tmesi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disque tulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n13860.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to carry different ways; to spread abroad, scatter, disperse, separate</hi> (cf.: reicere, proferre, procrastinare, producere, ampliare, prorogare—class.). </sense><sense id="n13860.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillas agere ac late differre favillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 675</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">favillam longe (ventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila (vis venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 273</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem (ventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casae venti magnitudine ignem distulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem partem classis (vis Africi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentes fractosque remos (Eurus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:6" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos cum scapha tempestas dextrovorsum Differt ab illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1088" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1088</bibl>: cytisum, <hi rend="ital">to plant apart, in separate rows</hi> = disserere, digerere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:43" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:30 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 30 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:38" default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:42 al" default="NO">42 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmos in versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut formicae frustillatim (te) differant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insepulta membra (lupi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:99" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 99</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Mettum in diversa (quadrigae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 643</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13860.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13860.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To distract, disquiet, disturb</hi> a person (only ante-class.): vorsor in <cb n="DIFF" /> amoris rota miser, Exanimor, feror, differor, distrahor, diripior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differor clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidine ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amore istius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—Less freq. <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dictis,</quote> <trans><tr>to confound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 125</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 4, 5</bibl> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n13860.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To spread abroad, publish, divulge;</hi> with a personal object, <hi rend="ital">to cry down, to defame</hi> (mostly anteclass. and post-Aug.; not in Cic., Caes., or Sall.). </sense><sense id="n13860.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: cum de me ista foris sermonibus differs, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 284, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores famam differant licebit nosque carpant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissam libertatem populo Rom. sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissum jus anulorum fama distulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 33</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mi hanc famam differant, Me dedidisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:753" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 753</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi> and dependent clause: <cit><quote lang="la">rumore ab obtrectatoribus dilato, quasi eundem mox et discruciatum necasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pertinuit differri etiam per externos, tamquam veneno interceptus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13860.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pipulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 32</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll., and see pipulum): aliquem maledicendo sermonibus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 284, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominos variis rumoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te circum omnes alias puellas,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring into disrepute with them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: differor sermone miser, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:93:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 93, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterna differor invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:48" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13860.8" n="3" level="3"> With reference to time, <hi rend="ital">to defer, put off, protract, delay</hi> any thing; with a personal object also <hi rend="ital">to put off, amuse with promises, get rid of</hi> (class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n13860.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera praesenti sermoni reserventur: hoc tamen non queo differre, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differre quotidie ac procrastinare rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe vadimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter in praesentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque (with omittere in praesens tempus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distulit ira sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 366</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">differri jam hora non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:724 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 724 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere distuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 2</bibl> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>, where agere belongs to proposuerat, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 49</bibl>).—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil dilaturi, quin periculum summae rerum facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>; with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua in crastinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in posterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliud tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adventum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem edicti in a. d. IV. Kal. Dec.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curandi tempus in annum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit> et saep. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tropaea in pueros suos,</quote> <trans><tr>to reserve for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:6:82" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 6, 82</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad crudelitatis tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n13860.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem differs me in tempus aliud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">differri non posse adeo concitatos animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilatus per frustrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem variis frustrationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem petentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit> Ern.: <cit><quote lang="la">caros amicos (opp. properare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:55" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 55</bibl></cit> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: vivacem anum, <hi rend="ital">to preserve alive</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to postpone her death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 519</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decimum dilatus in annum (belli) Hector erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in spem impetrandi tandem honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in septimum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 82</bibl> Oud.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.— Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati ad novos magistratus dilati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad finem muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (legationes) par tim dato responso ex itinere dimisit, partim distulit Tarraconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51</bibl></cit>.—Once with <hi rend="ital">post</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid post bellum differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13860.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> Prov.: differ; <cit><quote lang="la">habent parvae commoda magna morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:394" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 394</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13860.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut., to differ, be different</hi> (esp. freq. since the Ciceron. period—cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">discrepare, distare, interesse): qui re consentientes vocabulis differebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturis differunt, voluntate autem similes sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: verbo <pb n="575" /> <cb n="DIFF" /> differre, re esse unum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distare aliquid aut ex aliqua parte differre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aut non fere multum differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam differre, utrumne ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 251</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim differt, barathrone Dones quicquid habes, an? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13860.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut pauxillum differat a cavillulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidnam esset illud, quo ipsi (poëtae) differrent ab oratoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hoc ab illo differt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum ab hostili expugnatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum a Gallica consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fere ab reliquis differunt, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13860.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> (esp. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil inter deum et deum differt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequid inter privatum et magistratum differat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non multum differat inter summos et mediocres viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: multa sunt alia, quae inter locum et locum plurimum differunt (for which, shortly before, inter locorum naturas quantum <hi rend="ital">intersit</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cogitatione inter se differunt, re quidem copulata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: inter se aliqua re, id. Opt. gen. 2, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:34" default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:67" default="NO">67</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem inter se plurimum differunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13860.15" n="(d)" level="5"> Rarely with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasio cum tempore hoc differt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus causae cum superiore hoc differt, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30, 92</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Likewise rarely, differre in aliqua re, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Rarely, and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pede certo Differt sermoni sermo merus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragico differre colori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 236</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 23</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĕ-rens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., different, superior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">differentius nomen,</quote> <trans><tr>a more excellent name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; in Quintilian <hi rend="ital">subst. n.</hi> (opp. proprium), <hi rend="ital">a difference</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:58" default="NO">58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:66" default="NO">6, 3, 66</bibl>; 7, 3, 3; 25 sq.—*<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĕren-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">differently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
differtus: <entryFree id="n13861" type="main" key="differtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [farcio, kept asunder, stretched out by stuffing, i. e.], <sense id="n13861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stuffed full, filled, crowded</hi> (cf.: plenus, refertus, confertus—rare but class.; not in Cicero): plena lictorum provincia, differta exactoribus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus odoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Forum Appi nautis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differtum forum populumque = forum differtum populo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffibulo: <entryFree id="n13862" type="main" key="diffi_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fībŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unclasp, unbuckle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamydem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:570" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 570</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
difficile: <entryFree id="n13863" type="main" key="diffi^ci^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭcĭlē</orth>, <sense id="n13863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., with difficulty;</hi> v. foll. art. <hi rend="ital">fin., no.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
difficilis: <entryFree id="n13864" type="main" key="diffi^ci^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fĭcĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (old form difficul, like facul, famul, simul, etc., Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 111, 25</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>facilis; hence, far from easy to do, to accomplish, to bear, etc.; v. facilis</etym>, <sense id="n13864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hard, difficult, troublesome</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13864.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est tam facilis res, quin difficilis siet, quom invitus facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 20</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrorum diligentiam difficilem, apparatum perfacilem esse voluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae facilia ex difficillimis animi magnitudo redegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam graves, quam difficiles plerisque videntur calamitatum societates!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res arduae ac difficiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contortae res et difficiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam scopuloso difficilique in loco verser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in locos difficiles abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">iter angustum et difficile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 65, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficili et arduo ascensu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilis atque impedita palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus anni difficillimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficili rei publicae tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficillimo reip. tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilioribus usi tempestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 13, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 9, 83, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 13, 15</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DIFF" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">33 et saep.: (Macer et Lucretius) alter humilis, alter difficilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 87</bibl></cit> Frotsch.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium difficile est reperiri amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with a subjectclause,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 33</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 58, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile ad fidem est in tam antiqua re, quot pugnaverint ceciderintve exacto affirmare numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile est longum subito deponere amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 77, 13</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile est, crimen non prodere vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 447</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile est, tristi fingere mente jocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rebus) difficilibus ad eloquendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad percipiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 4.—With <hi rend="ital">supin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile factu est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">factu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditu (locus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Kritz.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus difficilis concoctioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 79, § 151</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in difficili esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in facili esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in difficili rem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille casus in difficili est, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:29:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 29, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13864.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of character, <hi rend="ital">hard to manage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to please, obstinate, captious, morose, surly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficiles ac morosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 407, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moderati nec difficiles nec inhumani senes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt morosi et anxii et iracundi et difficiles senes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avunculus difficillimā naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficili bile tumet jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: parens in liberos difficilis, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penelopen difficilem procis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocanti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gradivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A.
