A. 2, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>intractable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 179</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilem oportet aurem habere ad crimina,</quote> <trans><tr>deaf, inaccessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:133" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 133</bibl></cit> (Rib.).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in three forms (but the use of the <pos>adv.</pos> is mostly avoided by the best authors, difficile est taking its place, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n13864.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭcĭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 94, § 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13864.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭculter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi> (the usual form), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 52, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 54, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:3 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13864.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭcĭl-ĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with difficulty</hi> (rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl> and 50; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:1" default="NO">5, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13864.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:28" default="NO">11, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 28, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 43 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n13864.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficillime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:117 al" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 7, 35, § 117 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
difficiliter: <entryFree id="n13865" type="main" key="diffi^ci^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭcĭlĭter</orth>, <sense id="n13865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., with difficulty;</hi> v. difficilis <hi rend="ital">fin., no.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
difficul: <entryFree id="n13866" type="main" key="diffi^cul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭcul</orth>, v. difficilis <sense id="n13866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
difficultas: <entryFree id="n13867" type="main" key="diffi^cultas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭcultas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n13867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> difficultatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 3</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>difficilis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty, trouble, distress, poverty, want.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13867.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (freq. in good prose in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n13867.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineundi consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discendi (with labor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 47, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli gerendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciundi pontis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">viarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 56, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 70</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa navium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nummaria,</quote> <trans><tr>want. scarcity of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestica,</quote> <trans><tr>distressed circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13867.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua ob eam suspicionem difficultas eveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 2, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perspicio quantum in agendo difficultatis et quantum laboris sit habitura (altera pars actionis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">habere difficultatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam res ad receptum difficultatem afferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51, 6</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec res Caesari difficultatem ad consilium capiendum afferebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delabi in difficultates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17</bibl></cit>: erat in magnis<cb n="DIFF" />  difficultatibus res, ne, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 35</bibl> et saep.—*</sense><sense id="n13867.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (acc. to difficilis, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">obstinacy, captiousness, moroseness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogantiam pertulit, difficultatem exsorbuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
difficulter: <entryFree id="n13868" type="main" key="diffi^culter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffĭculter</orth>, <sense id="n13868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., with difficulty;</hi> v. difficilis <hi rend="ital">fin., no.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
diffidens: <entryFree id="n13869" type="main" key="diffi_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffīdens</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffīdenter</orth>, v. <itype>diffido</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
diffidentia: <entryFree id="n13870" type="main" key="diffi_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffīdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diffido</etym>, <sense id="n13870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of confidence, mistrust, distrust, diffidence</hi> (class.).—Without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidentiae contrarium est diffidentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> prooem. § 27; 9, 2, 72; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 543 al.</bibl>— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidentiam rei simulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:9 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 9 al.</bibl></cit>—With a <hi rend="ital">dependent clause</hi> (cf. diffido, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam diffidentiā, futurum quae imperavisset, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13870.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Want of faith, disobedience</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ira Dei in filios diffidentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ephes. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffido: <entryFree id="n13871" type="main" key="diffi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fīdo</orth>, <itype>fīsus</itype> (post-class. <sense id="n13871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> diffidi), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. n., to distrust; to be diffident</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distrustful, to despair</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13871.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">eum potius (corrupisse), qui sibi aliqua ratione diffideret, quam eum, qui omni ratione confideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 16, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:17:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 17, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi patriaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteri exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes">46, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">75, 1: suae atque omnium saluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summae rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 94 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuitati bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: prudentiae tuae, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis (viris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestibus monitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 397</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur M. Valerio non diffideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13871.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">dependent clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquissimi invenire se posse, quod cuperent, diffisi sint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:126 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 126 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos diffidas sanos facere, facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:157:13" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 157, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem manu superare posse diffiderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13871.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne terras aeterna teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:980" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 980</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13871.4" n="(d)" level="5"> Rarely with <case>abl.</case> (after the analogy of fido and confido): <cit><quote lang="la">diffisus occasione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 3</bibl></cit> Burm. and Oud.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">paucitate suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:8:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit> Oud.: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitate cohortium (al. paucitati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 20</bibl></cit> (also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 12, 2</bibl>, several good MSS. have voluntate; and <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 97, 2</bibl>: eo loco, v. Oud. on the former pass.).— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(facis) ex confidente actutum diffidentem denuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacet, diffidit, abjecit hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita graviter aeger, ut omnes medici diffiderent. id, Div. 1, 25, 53: de Othone, diffido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:43:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 43, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., without self-confidence, diffident, anxious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 65</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffīdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without self-confidence, diffidently</hi> (very rare): timide et diffidenter attingere aliquid, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidius ac diffidentius bella ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffindo: <entryFree id="n13872" type="main" key="diffindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-findo</orth>, <itype>fĭdi, fissum</itype> (also diffīsum), 3, <sense id="n13872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cleave asunder, to divide</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem mediam per medullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:41:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: malos, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 7</bibl> (Ann. v. 389 ed. Vahl., where the read. is, as in Non., defindunt): <cit><quote lang="la">ramum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen compressu suo (terra),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora plumbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 589</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 11</bibl> et saep.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium portas muneribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13872.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with an abstr. object: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctionem duplicem in longitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13872.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13872.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: equidem nihil hinc diffindere possum, <hi rend="ital">I cannot cut off aught of this</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I can refute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deny no part of it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneus rigentem servi tenacitatem violenter diffinderet,</quote> <trans><tr>to break by a bribe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 225</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n13872.5" n="B" level="2"> Diem, jurid. t. t., lit., <hi rend="ital">to break off</hi> a matter, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to put off to the following day, to defer</hi> (cf. differre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2, § 3</bibl>: triste <pb n="576" /> <cb n="DIFF" /> omen diem diffidit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 11</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n13872.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem somno,</quote> <trans><tr>to divide by taking a nap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffingo: <entryFree id="n13873" type="main" key="diffingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fingo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to form differently, to remodel, to make anew</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. passages). </sense><sense id="n13873.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum incude,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13873.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque diffinget infectumque reddet, Quod fugiens semel hora vexit,</quote> <trans><tr>to alter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 47</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 79</bibl> read diffindere).</sense></entryFree>
diffissio: <entryFree id="n13874" type="hapax" key="diffissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diffindo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n13874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the putting off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deferring of business to the following day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dierum diffissionibus comperendinationibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffissus: <entryFree id="n13875" type="main" key="diffissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from diffindo.</entryFree>
diffisus: <entryFree id="n13876" type="main" key="diffi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from diffido and diffindo.</entryFree>
diffiteor: <entryFree id="n13877" type="main" key="diffi^te^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fĭtĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <sense id="n13877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [fateor], <hi rend="ital">to disavow, to deny</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. passages—for syn. v. denego <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): numquam diffitebor multa me simulasse invitum, Planc. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>; so with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenum opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
difflatus: <entryFree id="n13878" type="main" key="diffla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">difflātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>difflo</etym>, <sense id="n13878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blowing in an opposite direction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffletus: <entryFree id="n13879" type="main" key="diffle_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-flētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fleo], <sense id="n13879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wept out, drained with weeping</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cognita clade uxor totos efflevit oculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> uint. Decl. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
difflo: <entryFree id="n13880" type="main" key="difflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to blow apart, disperse by blowing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatu disturbare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 10</bibl></cit> (ante- and post-class.): pars difflatur vento, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones spiritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: nubila (nimbi), Aus. Ephem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem (ventus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 388</bibl></cit>.—Fig., of political strife: <cit><quote lang="la">difflantibus procellis rempublicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffluo: <entryFree id="n13881" type="main" key="difflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-flŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to flow in different directions, to flow away</hi> (class.; repeatedly in Lucr.—cf.: laxo, rescindo, solvo). </sense><sense id="n13881.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffluere humorem cernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 436</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nos quasi extra ripas diffluentes coerceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in plures partes (Rhenus),</quote> <trans><tr>divides itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab summo tibi diffluat altus acervus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 198</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of that from which any thing flows: <cit><quote lang="la">duo juvenes, Sudore multo diffluentes,</quote> <trans><tr>dripping with perspiration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 25, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 44, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13881.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dissolve, melt away, disappear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privata cibo natura animantum Diffluit amittens corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1038</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga montium diffluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91, p. 19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, p. 19</bibl></cit> Bip.; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wasted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13881.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be dissolved in, abandoned to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriā et lasciviā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxu et inertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit> prooem. § 9, for which, in luxum, Prud: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:125" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">otio diffluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">risu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 132</bibl></cit>.—In rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffluens ac solutum,</quote> <trans><tr>loose, not periodic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">233</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis humidis et lapsantibus diffluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffluus: <entryFree id="n13882" type="hapax" key="difflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">difflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diffluo</etym>, <sense id="n13882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing asunder, overflowing</hi>, Matius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffluvio: <entryFree id="n13883" type="hapax" key="difflu^vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-flŭvĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fluvius; cf. quadrifluvium</etym> (qs. to part into two streams, i. e.), <sense id="n13883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide, to split</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. Schne<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ad Pall. 12:15:3, p. 207 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Pall. 12, 15, 3, p. 207 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diffluxio: <entryFree id="n13884" type="hapax" key="diffluxi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffluxĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diffluo</etym>, <sense id="n13884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing off, discharge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffors: <entryFree id="n13885" type="main" key="diffors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffors</orth>, -rtis, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dis-fors</etym>: oratio, <sense id="n13885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of defence, by which the act charged is admitted, but justified</hi>, Jul. Victor, Art. Rhet. 3, 3; 5.</sense></entryFree>
diffractus: <entryFree id="n13886" type="main" key="diffractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from diffringo.</entryFree>
diffringo: <entryFree id="n13887" type="main" key="diffringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fringo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dīfr-</orth>), no <sense id="n13887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, fractum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to break in pieces, to shatter</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basin Colossici Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffugio: <entryFree id="n13888" type="main" key="diffu^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fŭgĭo</orth>, <itype>fūgi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to fly asunder, flee in different directions, to disperse, scatter</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">diffugiebat enim varium genus omne ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1337 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1337 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:256" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 256</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:762 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 762 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox una diffugit in multas aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu perterriti repente diffugimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 108</bibl></cit>; id. Fam. <cb n="DIFF" /> 15, 1, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 32, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 212</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:211" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 257</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffugiunt stellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffugere nives,</quote> <trans><tr>to scatter, disappear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordaces sollicitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota exterrita silvis Diffugiunt armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:804" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 804</bibl>.—Designating the limit: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus unguenti suavis diffugit in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vicos passim suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sua praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:35" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 255</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffugium: <entryFree id="n13889" type="hapax" key="diffu^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffŭgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>diffugio</etym>, <sense id="n13889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fleeing in different directions, a dispersion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximorum diffugia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
diffugo: <entryFree id="n13890" type="main" key="diffu^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fŭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to put to flight, scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulis diffugatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> in Psa. 41, 10</bibl></cit>: episcopos, Marcel. Com. Chron. An. 484.</sense></entryFree>
diffulguro: <entryFree id="n13891" type="hapax" key="diffulgu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fulgŭro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scatter lightning around</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffulmino: <entryFree id="n13892" type="hapax" key="diffulmi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fulmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scatter</hi> a multitude, qs. by lightning, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:276" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 276</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffumigo: <entryFree id="n13893" type="hapax" key="diffu_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fūmĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to fumigate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diffundito: <entryFree id="n13894" type="main" key="diffundi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffundĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>diffundo</etym>, <sense id="n13894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour out, scatter, spread</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only post-class.): pretium per domos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex sese,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubique sese diffunditans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris vi diffunditari ac didier,</quote> <trans><tr>to be consumed, wasted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffundo: <entryFree id="n13895" type="main" key="diffundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fundo</orth>, <itype>fūdi, fūsum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to spread by pouring, to pour out, pour forth</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13895.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(glacies) liquefacta se diffunderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis per venas in omne corpus diffunditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(unda) diffunditur Hellesponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 359</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum freta diffundi jussit,</quote> <trans><tr>to pour themselves forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum de doliis,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw off, bottle off; to fill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">racking off</hi> wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 4</bibl> Krüg. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:517" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 517</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:30" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 14, 16, § 94</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13895.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of objects not liquid, <hi rend="ital">to spread, scatter, diffuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitet diffuso lumine caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luce diffusa toto caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 26</bibl>: ab ejus summo rami late diffunduntur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. under <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dederatque comam diffundere ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 319</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:538" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 538</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa (i. e. astra) caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitem latis campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 465</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">modo via coartatur, modo latissimis pratis diffunditur et patescit,</quote> <trans><tr>opens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus in totas usque ab radicibus imis, per truncos ac per ramos, diffunditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 354</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem vocum per aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim mali Herculeos per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum se diffudit in venas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera late in omnes partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam in omne latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 24</bibl> et saep.</sense><sense id="n13895.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spread, diffuse, scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di vim suam longe lateque diffundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">error longe lateque diffusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 115</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">late longeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus alicujus late longeque diffusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">late et varie diffusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flendo diffundimus iram,</quote> <trans><tr>we moderate, temper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem suum flendo,</quote> <trans><tr>to give vent to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam oblivionem sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudia nunc a quo diffunditur et tribus et gens Per Latium,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads itself out, branches out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffunditur mare iterumque contrahitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crede animam quoque diffundi multoque perire Ocius, et citius dissolvi in corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus per totam actionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella et paces longum in aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in ora virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam in arma cruore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 908</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen paucarum in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope in immensum oratio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde doctrina se diffudit per ceteras Graeciae partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Serm. 150, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13895.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (like dissolvere, solvere, remittere, etc., and opp. contrahere, adducere, etc.), with the accessory idea of non-restraint, freedom, qs, to let the heart, countenance, etc., flow freely, without constraint, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cheer up, gladden, exhilarate</hi>: diffundet animos omnibus<cb n="DIGE" />  ista dies, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 218</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13895.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the persons themselves: ut ex bonis amici quas diffundantur et incommodis contrahantur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem memorant, diffusum nectare, curas Seposuisse graves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 318</bibl></cit>, imitated by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:54" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 54</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffusus in risum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 71, 1 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., spread abroad, spread out, extended, wide</hi> (a favorite expression of the post-Aug. prosaists). </sense><sense id="n13895.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">platanus patulis diffusa ramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffusiora consepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:31" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latior scena et corona diffusior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus (opp. angusta),</quote> <trans><tr>stout, fat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13895.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus civile, quod nunc diffusum et dissipatum est, in certa genera coacturum,</quote> <trans><tr>diffuse, prolix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus diffusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. to the writers: Diophanes totum Dionysium, per multa diffusum volumina, sex epitomis circumscripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplius ac diffusius meritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:53:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 53, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diffūsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a scattered manner; copiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res disperse et diffuse dictae unum in locum coguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec latius aliquando dicenda sunt et diffusius,</quote> <trans><tr>more amply, more in full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:10:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
diffusilis: <entryFree id="n13896" type="hapax" key="diffu_si^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffūsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diffundo</etym>, <sense id="n13896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diffusive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 467</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffusio: <entryFree id="n13897" type="hapax" key="diffu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diffundo</etym>. <sense id="n13897.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The spreading out, extending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13897.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cheerfulness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffusor: <entryFree id="n13898" type="gloss" key="diffu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n13898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawer-off</hi> of liquids: <cit><quote lang="la">OLEARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4077</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diffusus: <entryFree id="n13899" type="main" key="diffu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diffūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from diffundo.</entryFree>
diffututus: <entryFree id="n13900" type="hapax" key="diffu^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dif-fŭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>futuo</etym>, <sense id="n13900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exhausted by indulgence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digamia: <entryFree id="n13901" type="greek" key="di^ga^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">digami/a</foreign>, <sense id="n13901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marrying twice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
digammon: <entryFree id="n13902" type="greek" key="di^gammon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgammon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgamma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgammos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. littera), = <foreign lang="greek">di/gammon</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">stoixei=on</foreign>) or <foreign lang="greek">di/gamma</foreign>, <sense id="n13902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Aeolic double gamma</hi> or <hi rend="ital">digamma</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">v</foreign>), represented in Latin sometimes by V, sometimes by F, which, written upside down, thus, F, the Emperor Claudius wished to substitute for both F and V, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl> (v. the letters F and V). </sense><sense id="n13902.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Digammon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl> Zumpt and Meyer <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 70</bibl>; Don. p. 1736 P. Lind. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2292</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n13902.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Digammos littera, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2387" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2387</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply digammos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Aen. 1, 292</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">642</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 359</bibl>; Pompei. ad Don. p. 21 Lind. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n13902.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Digamma, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 542</bibl> P.; 545 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> ib.; 709 ib. al.— </sense><sense id="n13902.4" n="II" level="1"> Used jestingly to denote <hi rend="ital">an incomebook</hi> (from the title Fundorum reditus, the first letter of which is a digamma), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digamus: <entryFree id="n13903" type="greek" key="di^ga^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgămus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/gamos</foreign>, <sense id="n13903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has been married twice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exh. ad Cast. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
digentia: <entryFree id="n13904" type="main" key="Di^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small, clear stream that flowed by Horace's villa, and fell into the Anio about nine miles above Tibur, near the village of Mandela</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Licenza</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digeries: <entryFree id="n13905" type="main" key="di_ge^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>digero</etym>, <sense id="n13905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orderly distribution, a disposition, arrangement</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1</bibl>; praef. § 7; 1, 16, § 38. </sense><sense id="n13905.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Digestion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 14, 4, 4, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 20, 21, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digero: <entryFree id="n13906" type="main" key="di_ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-gĕro</orth>, <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to force apart, separate, divide, distribute</hi> (cf.: dispono, distribuo, divido, dispenso, ordino, compono). </sense><sense id="n13906.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13906.2" n="A" level="2"> Ingen. (so mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">(insulae) interdum discordantibus ventis digeruntur (opp. junctae copulataeque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nubes (opp. congregare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 30, § 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digesti colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:213" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercoris pars in prata digerenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix digesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque canes totidem trunco digestus ab uno Cerberus,</quote> <trans><tr>divided, separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: Nilus <pb n="577" /> <cb n="DIGE" /> septem in cornua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:774" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 774</bibl> (for which, septem discretus in ostia Nilus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 324</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Crete centum per urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus in classes (coupled with distributus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:83" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 83</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(augur Thestorides) novem volucres in belli digerit annos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>explains, interprets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 21</bibl></cit> (cf. omina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 182</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n13906.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13906.4" n="1" level="3"> (Post-Aug.): cibum, <hi rend="ital">to cut up, divide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dentes) qui digerunt cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and still more freq., like the class. concoquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Controv. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Controv. 1</bibl></cit> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13906.5" n="2" level="3"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to dissolve, dissipate</hi> morbid matter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18</bibl> (twice); 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 2, 17 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 25, § 41 al.</bibl>— Very freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n13906.6" n="3" level="3"> With the accessory notion of arrangement, <hi rend="ital">to distribute, arrange, dispose, set in order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (accepti tabulas) diligentissime legi et digessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: crines, Col. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> 10, 165; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crines ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:63" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagum,</quote> <trans><tr>to plant in regular rows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:161:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 161, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 149</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 54</bibl> and 267: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecam,</quote> <trans><tr>to arrange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina in numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 446</bibl></cit> (ordinat, disponit, Serv.).</sense><sense id="n13906.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13906.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to distribute</hi> (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam meruit solus poenam digessit in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 469</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mala per annos longos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">annum in totidem species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—Freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n13906.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to arrange, set in order, distribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos usus ejus suo loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to relate in order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 37</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">omina,</quote> <trans><tr>interprets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 182</bibl></cit> (cf. above, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">post descripte et electe in genus quodque causae, quid cuique conveniat, ex hac copia digeremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne jus civile in genera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarios in libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: argumenta in digitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarium per genera usus sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—With a <hi rend="ital">relat. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid quoque anno actum sit, in tanta vetustate non modo rerum sed etiam auctorum digerere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: senium, <hi rend="ital">digest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:92" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 92</bibl> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">gh=ras e(/yein</foreign>, Pind. Olym. 1, 133).—</sense><sense id="n13906.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To consider maturely</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13906.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To exercise</hi> (for health): si satis valet, gestando aegrum, digerere; <cit><quote lang="la">si parum, intra domum tamen dimovere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne imbecillum hominem nimis digerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13906.12" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">That has a good digestion</hi>: purissimus et digestissimus, Marc. Empir. c. 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n13906.13" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgesta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a name given to a collection of writings distributed under certain heads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; esp. of Justinian's code of laws, <hi rend="ital">the Pandects, Digests;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Cod. 1:17:3:section=1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Cod. 1, 17, 3, § 1</bibl>.—Also to <hi rend="ital">the Bible</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digestum Lucae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Gospel of Luke</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digestibilis: <entryFree id="n13907" type="main" key="di_gesti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>digero, I. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n13907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to digestion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>digestible, easy of digestion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:159" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oxygarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>promoting digestion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:34" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digestilis: <entryFree id="n13908" type="main" key="di_gesti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">promoting digestion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">meatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digestim: <entryFree id="n13909" type="hapax" key="di_gestim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>digero</etym>, <sense id="n13909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in order</hi>: aliquid scribere, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 129.</sense></entryFree>
digestio: <entryFree id="n13910" type="main" key="di_gesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n13910.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dividing of food, dissolving, digestion</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sive concoctio sit illa, sive tantum digestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § 63; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 14, § 7: facilis ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 13</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13910.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An orderly distribution, division, arrangement</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13910.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:53" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: (Italiae) in literas, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an orderly description</hi> (shortly before, descriptio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13910.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., as rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">enumeration</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">merismo/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO">9, 2, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:33:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 33, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digestivus: <entryFree id="n13911" type="main" key="di_gesti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:I. B. 1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> I. B. 1</bibl>.</etym>, <sense id="n13911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to digestion, digestive</hi>: vis, Macer, Carm. 1, 18. <cb n="DIGI" /></sense></entryFree>
digestorius: <entryFree id="n13912" type="main" key="di_gesto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">promoting digestion</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: embamma, Marc. Empir. 20.</sense></entryFree>
digestus: <entryFree id="n13913" type="main" key="di_gestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from digero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13914" type="hapax" key="di_gestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgestus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>digero</etym>, <sense id="n13914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distributing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctarum opum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>management of the imperial treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digitabulum: <entryFree id="n13915" type="main" key="di^gi^ta_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgĭtābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>digitus</etym>, <sense id="n13915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glove worn in gathering olives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melior ea quae digitis nudis legitur quam illa quae cum digitabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 1</bibl></cit> (al. digitalibus); cf. <foreign lang="greek">daktulh/qra</foreign>, digitabulum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Philox.</author> p. 73, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digitalis: <entryFree id="n13916" type="main" key="di^gi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the finger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 20, 23, § 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 1</bibl> Schneid. and Gesn. (al. digitabulis).</sense></entryFree>
digitatus: <entryFree id="n13917" type="hapax" key="di^gi^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having fingers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 47, 107, § 256</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
