digitillum: <entryFree id="n13918" type="main" key="di^gi^tillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgĭtillum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tellum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant house-leek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 45, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:163 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 15, 92, § 163 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
digitulus: <entryFree id="n13919" type="main" key="di^gi^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgĭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little finger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 53</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 24</bibl>: aniculae collum digitulis duobus oblidere, Cic. Scaur. Fragm. § 10 al.—</sense><sense id="n13919.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the parrot's foot, <hi rend="ital">a toe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 349</bibl>; of the <hi rend="ital">claw</hi> of a crab, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 9, 1</bibl> Oehler (Riese, digitis).</sense></entryFree>
digitus: <entryFree id="n13920" type="main" key="di^gi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭgĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulos</foreign>; cf. Germ. Zehe, Eng. toe; from root <foreign lang="greek">dek</foreign>（<foreign lang="greek">de/xomai</foreign>), to grasp, receive; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Germ. Finger, from fangen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. 133" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. 133</bibl></cit>. Corssen, however, still refers digitus to root dik-, dico, <foreign lang="greek">dei/knumi</foreign>, as the pointer, indicator, Ausspr. 1, 380; cf. dico</etym>, <sense id="n13920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a finger</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13920.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tot (cyathos bibimus), quot digiti sunt tibi in manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 57</bibl> et saep.—The special designations: pollex, <hi rend="ital">the thumb;</hi> index or salutaris, <hi rend="ital">the forefinger;</hi> medius, also infamis and impudicus, <hi rend="ital">the middle finger;</hi> minimo proximus or medicinalis, <hi rend="ital">the ring-finger;</hi> minimus, <hi rend="ital">the little finger</hi>, v. under those words.— </sense><sense id="n13920.2" n="B" level="2"> Special connections: <cit><quote lang="la">attingere aliquem digito (uno),</quote> <trans><tr>to touch one lightly, gently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 2</bibl> Ruhnk.; Licinius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 55</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">attingere aliquid extremis digitis (with primoribus labris gustare),</quote> <trans><tr>to touch lightly, to enjoy slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attingere caelum digito,</quote> <trans><tr>to be exceedingly happy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: colere summis digitis, <hi rend="ital">to adore</hi> (to touch the offering or consecrated gift) <hi rend="ital">with the tips of the fingers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">computare digitis,</quote> <trans><tr>to count on the fingers, to reckon up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 29, § 88; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare per digitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:123" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in digitis suis singulas partis causae constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caec. 14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caec. 14, 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, venire ad digitos, <hi rend="ital">to be reckoned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 87</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">si tuos digitos novi,</quote> <trans><tr>thy skill in reckoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: digerere argumenta in digitos,</quote> <trans><tr>to count on the fingers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: concrepare digitos or digitis, <hi rend="ital">to snap the fingers</hi>, as a signal of command, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19</bibl>; v. concrepo; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: digitus crepans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum crepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum percussio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere digitum ad aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to point the finger at any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liceri digito,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold up the finger in bidding at an auction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: tollere digitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>. The latter phrase also signifies, <hi rend="ital">to raise the finger in token of submission</hi>, said of a combatant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 29:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 29, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Schol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:119" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui digitis nutuque,</quote> <trans><tr>to talk by signs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:453" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 453</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">different is: postquam fuerant digiti cum voce locuti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>playing as an accompaniment to singing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad digiti sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 587</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1384" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1384</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito compesce labellum,</quote> <trans><tr>hold your tongue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 160</bibl></cit>.—For the various modes of employing the fingers in oratorical delivery, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO">11, 3, 92</bibl> sq.; 103; 120 al.: monstrari digito, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be pointed out, to become distinguished,<cb n="DIGN" />  famous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: demonstrari digito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Datam. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Datam. 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl>.—Prov. phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit, quot digitos habeat in manu, of one who knows nothing at all,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in digitis hodie percoquam quod ceperit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he has caught nothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: ne digitum quidem porrigere, <hi rend="ital">not to stretch out a finger</hi>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulon mh\ protei=nai, e)ktei=nai</foreign>, for <hi rend="ital">not to give one's self the least trouble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 57</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exserere digitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:119" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 119</bibl></cit> Scal.; <cit><quote lang="la">and in like manner: proferre digitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to move a finger, to make any exertion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalpere caput digito, of effeminate men fearful of disarranging their hair,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 52" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; a habit of Pompey's, acc. to Calvus ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 726</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 11</bibl>. (Cf. Echtermeyer's Ueber Namen und symbolische Bedeutung der Finger bei den Griechen und Römern, Progr. d. Hall. Pädagogiums, v. 1835.)</sense><sense id="n13920.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13920.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A toe</hi> (cf. Heb. <foreign />, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulos</foreign>, Fr. <hi rend="ital">doigt</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 426</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 111" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl> et saep.; also of the <hi rend="ital">toes</hi> of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:119 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 119 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13920.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small bough, a twig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:224" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13920.6" n="C" level="2"> As a measure of length, <hi rend="ital">an inch</hi>, the sixteenth part of a Roman foot (pes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 24 sq" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 24 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:59 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 59 al.</bibl>: digiti primores, <hi rend="ital">finger-ends</hi>, as a measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:21:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 21, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">digitus transversus,</quote> <trans><tr>a fingerbreadth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">48, 2.—Prov.: digitum transversum non discedere ab aliqua re,</quote> <trans><tr>not to swerve a finger's breadth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">without transversum: nusquam ab argento digitum discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ellipt.: ab honestissima sententia digitum nusquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13921" type="main" key="Di^gi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭgĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>: Digiti Idaei = <foreign lang="greek">*da/ktuloi *)idai=oi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the priests of Cybele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 41</bibl> and 43, and v. Dactylus.</sense></entryFree>
digladiabilis: <entryFree id="n13922" type="hapax" key="di_gla^di^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīglădĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>digladior</etym>, <sense id="n13922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of contention, fierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 147</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digladior: <entryFree id="n13923" type="main" key="di_gla^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-glădĭor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n13923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [gladius], <hi rend="ital">to fight for life and death, to contend fiercely</hi> (a Ciceron. word). </sense><sense id="n13923.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cives inter se sicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13923.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to contend warmly, dispute</hi>, sc. with words: <cit><quote lang="la">de quibus inter se digladiari solent (philosophi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: cum aliquo tot voluminibus, id. Ac. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 65, 14</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coupled with depugnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digladientur illi, per me licet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diglossos: <entryFree id="n13924" type="greek" key="di_^glo_ssos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^glōssos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">di/glwssos</foreign> = bilinguis, <sense id="n13924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedum alum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digma: <entryFree id="n13925" type="greek" key="di_gma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dei=gma</foreign>, <sense id="n13925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a specimen</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 4, 9.</sense></entryFree>
dignabilis: <entryFree id="n13926" type="main" key="digna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dignor</etym>, <sense id="n13926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dignanter: <entryFree id="n13927" type="main" key="dignanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignanter</orth>, <sense id="n13927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., courteously</hi>, etc., v. dignor <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dignatio: <entryFree id="n13928" type="main" key="digna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dignor</etym>, <sense id="n13928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a considering worthy</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; esp. in Tac. and Suet.). </sense><sense id="n13928.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a deeming worthy, respect, esteem, regard</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">dignatione aliquem diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu in summa dignatione regis vixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13928.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with respect to the person who enjoys such esteem, <hi rend="ital">dignity, honor, reputation</hi>, for dignitas: <cit><quote lang="la">de dignatione laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9, 2</bibl></cit> (al. dignitate): <cit><quote lang="la">reddere honorem sacerdotiis dignatione sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:3" default="NO">2, 69, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl> (al. indignatione); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 46</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
digne: <entryFree id="n13929" type="main" key="digne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignē</orth>, <sense id="n13929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., worthily, fitly, becomingly</hi>, v. dignus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dignitas: <entryFree id="n13930" type="main" key="digni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (<sense id="n13930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> dignitatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 9, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Florian. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">-tatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 17, 2</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dignus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n13930.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a being worthy, worth, worthiness, merit, desert</hi> (so, rarely, and perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lamia petit praeturam: omnesque intelligunt nec dignitatem ei deesse nec gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 17</bibl></cit>; id. Agr. <pb n="578" /> <cb n="DIGN" /> 2, 2, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas consularis,</quote> <trans><tr>a being worthy of the office of consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro dignitate laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13930.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (the cause for the effect), <hi rend="ital">dignity, greatness, grandeur, authority, rank</hi> (cf. honos, honestas, laus, existimatio, gloria, fama, nomen). </sense><sense id="n13930.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: mihi gratulabere, quod audisses me pristinam meam dignitatem obtinere. Ego autem, si dignitas est bene de re publica sentire, obtineo dignitatem meam; <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem in eo dignitas est, si, quod sentias, re efficere possis, ne vestigium quidem ullum est reliquum nobis dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas (est) alicujus honesta et cultu et honore et verecundia digna auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:55:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 55, 156</bibl></cit>: cum pulchritudinis duo genera sint, quorum in altero venustas est, in altero dignitas; <cit><quote lang="la">venustatem muliebrem ducere debemus, dignitatem virilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl>: corporis, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 1, 2</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere cum dignitate ac venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum dignitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">141: retinere in rebus asperis dignitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 85, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatu conservanda auctoritas, apud populum dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 153</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">celsissima sedes dignitatis atque honoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tam alto dignitatis gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27</bibl> (twice): <cit><quote lang="la">est in ipsis (liberis populis) magnus delectus hominum et dignitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex humili loco ad summam dignitatem perducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem dignitate exaequare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut secundum locum dignitatis Remi obtinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 1</bibl>; 7, 66, 5; 7, 77, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13930.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13930.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Official dignity, honorable employment, office</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratulor laetorque tum praesenti tum etiam sperata tua dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 35</bibl>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 21, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 61, 2 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n13930.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Men holding high office, men in honorable employment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dignitates abessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 40, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13930.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">worth, value, excellence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opsonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara et plena dignitatis domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus, urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas, quae est in latitudine pectoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:141" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debita rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dignitate actionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:54 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 54 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dignitosus: <entryFree id="n13931" type="hapax" key="digni^to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignĭtōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dignitas</etym>, <sense id="n13931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dignified, respectable</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)ciwmatiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
digno: <entryFree id="n13932" type="main" key="digno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">digno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dignus</etym>, <sense id="n13932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to deem worthy</hi>: quis caelestes dignet decorare hostiis, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 15</bibl>; so with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 470, 20</bibl>; ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 169</bibl>; and in Diomed. p. 395 P.; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 19</bibl>: hunc tanto munere digna, Calvus ap. Serv. l. l.; so with <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13932.1" n="b" level="4"> Dignor, āri, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: egone Pelopis digner domo, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 7</bibl>; so with <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 36</bibl>; id. Oecon. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; Verg A. 3, 475; and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:569" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 569</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dignor: <entryFree id="n13933" type="main" key="dignor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [dignus], <hi rend="ital">to deem worthy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deserving</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n13933.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud equidem tali me dignor honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 335</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 521</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">te alio funere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc mensa, cubili (dea),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem non sermone, non visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellum veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:14:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 14, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 1, 8, 9 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13933.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ciw=</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">a)ciou=mai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to regard as fit, becoming, worthy of one's self, to deign;</hi> and with a negative, <hi rend="ital">not to deign, to disdain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nemo suspicere in caeli dignatur lucida templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1039" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1039</bibl></cit>; so with a neg., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 407</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 732</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">866</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl> 464; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 158</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 13 al.</bibl>—Affirmatively: <cit><quote lang="la">quos eximia specie donare natura dignata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui se pulcra viro dignetur jungere Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:540" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 540</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 52</bibl>; Suet. Vesp. <cb n="DIGN" /> 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:28:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si digneris audire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13933.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o felix si quem dignabitur, inquit, ista virum,</quote> <trans><tr>will hold worthy to be her husband</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 326</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">regem nostrum filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13933.4" n="(d)" level="5"> Ellipt. with one <case>acc.</case> (the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> to be supplied from the context): <cit><quote lang="la">orant succedere muris Dignarique domos (sc. visere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:785" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo Macedonum dignante Parthorum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dignanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., courteously, with complaisance</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">loquentem dignanter audite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impertire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:63" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 63</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> Auct. Itin. Alex. 10.</sense></entryFree>
dignorant: <entryFree id="n13934" type="gloss" key="di_gno_rant"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgnōrant</orth>, <itype>signa imponunt, ut fieri solet in pecoribus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 16</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
dignoscentia: <entryFree id="n13935" type="main" key="di_gnoscenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgnoscentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dignosco</etym>, <sense id="n13935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the power of distinguishing, knowledge</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mali et boni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> de Gen. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dignosco: <entryFree id="n13936" type="main" key="di_gnosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-gnosco</orth>, v. dinosco.</entryFree>
dignus: <entryFree id="n13937" type="main" key="dignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>i. e. DIC-nus; root in Sanscr. daç-as, fame; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">doke/w, do/ca</foreign>; Lat.: decet, decus</etym>, <sense id="n13937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy, deserving</hi> (in a good or ill sense), of things, <hi rend="ital">suitable, fitting, becoming, proper</hi> (very freq. in all periods and kinds of writing).—Constr., in the most finished models of composition, with the <hi rend="ital">abl. pretii, a relative sentence</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> in the Aug. poets also freq. with the <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> otherwise with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, or the <case>acc.</case> of a <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> or <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13937.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">dignus domino servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 227</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir patre, avo, majoribus suis dignissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes patre digni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 24</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus es verberibus multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici novi digni amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa laude digni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus probris, quae improbis viris Digna sunt, dignior nullus est homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentatio, quae non modo amico, sed ne libero quidem digna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignius odio scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o fons, dulci digne mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera digna venustissima Venere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; for which; diem dignum Veneri (<case>abl.</case> v. Venus), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te dignam mala malam aetatem exigas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 26</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendum dignum aliquid horum auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memoria dignum consequi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:21:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 21, 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid antea admisissem piaculo dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuere id cuique, quod sit quoque dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim decorum est neque dis dignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid dignum sapiente bonoque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere Cinnā digna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 36</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. with <hi rend="ital">supine in u</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna memoratu produntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil dignum dictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 43, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:56" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13937.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi> (freq., though not in the Aug. poets): <cit><quote lang="la">non videre dignus, qui liber sies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modeste paret, videtur, qui aliquando imperet, dignus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines dignos, quibuscum disseratur putant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 131</bibl> et saep.—So with <hi rend="ital">rel. adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive adeo digna res est ubi tu nervos intendas tuos,</quote> <trans><tr>if the thing is really worth your bending your energies to it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: dignos esse, qui armis cepissent, eorum urbem agrumque Bolanum esse, i. e. ut eorum urbs esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. (Madv. dignum, cf. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign> infra).—</sense><sense id="n13937.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (that of which some one or something is worthy, to be supplied from the context): <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Quem ament igitur? <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Alium quemlibet; <cit><quote lang="la">Nam nostrorum nemo dignus est (sc. amari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne nimis cito diligere incipiant neve non dignos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud exemplum ab dignis et idoneis ad indignos et non idoneos transfertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 27</bibl></cit> Kritz.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignis ait esse paratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes, ait, malle laudatos a se, dignos indignosque, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem dices digniorem esse hominem hodie Athenis alterum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus patronus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: dignior heres, Hor. <cb n="DIGR" /> C. 2, 14, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">digna causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignum operae pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignas grates persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 600</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 537</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna gloria ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 168</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tuam formam illa digna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; so, quod supplicium dignum libidini ejus invenias? (where the <case>dat.</case> depends on the verb), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:26:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 26, 16, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id, cum ipse per se dignus putaretur, impetravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—So as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: "nulla contumelia est, quam facit dignus;" primum quid est <hi rend="ital">dignus?</hi> nam etiam malo multi digni, sicut ipse (Antonius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 22</bibl>; so, dignum est, <hi rend="ital">it is fit, proper, becoming</hi>, = aequum est, decet, convenit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 1, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:391 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 391 al.</bibl>—So <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 53, 146</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13937.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq. in the Aug. poets; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:311" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisse conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:833" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrere spatium vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:8:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 14</bibl></cit> al.; and more freq. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantari dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">describi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 72</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoribus hoc dedi, quibus dignius credi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque optimus erat, dignusque alter elegi, alter eligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum dignus prae te, ut figam palum in parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16</bibl>: eras dignus ut haberes integram manum; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:24" default="NO">12, 11, 24</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/cio/s tinos</foreign>—so freq. in Inscr. v. Wordsworth, Fragm. p. 494): <cit><quote lang="la">dignus salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cogitatio dignissima tuae virtutis, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl> A.: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid putabit dignum esse memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> of a <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> or <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me censes scire quid dignus siem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si exoptem, quantum dignus, tantum dent (di tibi), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad tuam formam illa una digna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus, dignus huic ad imitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si digna poena pro factis eorum reperitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dignē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">worthily, fitly, becomingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam digne ornata incedit, haud meretricie!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 2</bibl>; Cassius in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:67" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 164 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 47</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
digredior: <entryFree id="n13938" type="main" key="di_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to go apart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">asunder, to separate, part; to go away, depart</hi>, = discedere (class.). </sense><sense id="n13938.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna tum congrediens cum sole, tum digrediens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">digredimur paulum rursumque ad bella coimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita utrique digrediuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">digredimur flentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi digressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 80</bibl></cit>.—With term. <hi rend="ital">a quo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam est a me digressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 7 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a marito,</quote> <trans><tr>to abandon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a colloquio Caninii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Corcyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:72:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 72, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex colloquio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triclinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6 al.</bibl></cit> —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos ego digrediens lacrimis affabar obortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 492</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:69 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 69 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dein statim digrediens,</quote> <trans><tr>stepping aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz. —With term. <hi rend="ital">ad quem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambo in sua castra digressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 109:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 109, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem ad capessendos magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sua tutanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seleuciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digredientem eum cum Caesare circumsistunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13938.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go aside, deviate, depart</hi>. —With term. <hi rend="ital">a quo</hi>: nos nostro officio nihil digressos esse. * <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13938.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in speaking or writing, <hi rend="ital">to digress</hi> (but de-gredi, which is sometimes found in edd. in this sense is incorrect, v. h. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">digredi ab eo, quod proposueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parumper a causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93</bibl></cit> <pb n="579" /> <cb n="DILA" /> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo et regredi in id,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe datur ad commovendos animos digrediendi locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 312</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 19, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:17" default="NO">4, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum huc longius, quam voluntas fuit, ab epistola Timarchidi digressa est oratio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eo jam, unde huc digressi sumus, revertamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digressio: <entryFree id="n13939" type="main" key="di_gressi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgressĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>digredior</etym>, <sense id="n13939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parting, separating; a going away, departing, departure</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n13939.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (in this signif. more freq. digressus): <cit><quote lang="la">congressio, tum vero digressio nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n13939.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a going aside, deviation;</hi> esp. in lang., <hi rend="ital">digression</hi>: qualis ad adjuvandum (sc. amicum) digressio (sc. a recto, referring to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proposita oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 85</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of speech,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 312</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 53</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:28" default="NO">9, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:56 al" default="NO">9, 2, 56 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
digressivus: <entryFree id="n13940" type="main" key="di_gressi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgressīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to digression, digressive</hi>: relatio, Cassiod. Inst. Div. litt. 4.</sense></entryFree>
digressus: <entryFree id="n13941" type="main" key="di_gressus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgressus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from digredior.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13942" type="main" key="di_gressus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīgressus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>digredior</etym>, <sense id="n13942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parting, separating; a going away, departure</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13942.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">congressus nostri lamentationem pertimui, digressum vero non tulissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. accessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">c. c. discessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:107 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 107 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n13942.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> only in Quint., <hi rend="ital">a deviating</hi> in speech, <hi rend="ital">digression</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:14" default="NO">4, 3, 14</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
digrunnio: <entryFree id="n13943" type="hapax" key="di_grunni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-grunnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n13943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to grunt hard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 27</bibl> (unless we should rather read <hi rend="ital">de</hi>grunnit).</sense></entryFree>
dii: <entryFree id="n13944" type="main" key="dii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dii</orth>. <sense id="n13944.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Nom. plur.</hi>, from deus, q. v.— </sense><sense id="n13944.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Arch. gen.</hi>, from dies, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
diiambus: <entryFree id="n13945" type="greek" key="di^i^ambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭĭambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dii/+ambos</foreign>, <sense id="n13945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double iambus</hi>: ˘¯˘¯, Don. p. 1739 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 477</bibl> ib. et saep. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2415" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2415</bibl> P., written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
dijovis: <entryFree id="n13946" type="main" key="Di^jo^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭjŏvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Diovis.</entryFree>
dijudicatio: <entryFree id="n13947" type="hapax" key="di_ju_di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dījūdĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dijudico</etym>, <sense id="n13947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judging, deciding, determining</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dijudicatrix: <entryFree id="n13948" type="main" key="di_ju_di^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dījūdĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that judges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 15, 23</bibl></cit>; p. 179 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
dijudico: <entryFree id="n13949" type="main" key="di_ju_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-jūdĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13949.0" n="1" level="3"> With the idea of the verb predominating, <hi rend="ital">to judge by discerning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinguishing; to decide, determine</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13949.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego dicam, quod mihi in mentem venit: tu dijudica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:8 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena melius quam sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callide verbis controversias, non aequitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (sc. uxorem) omnium Thebis vir unam esse optimam dijudicat,</quote> <trans><tr>judges, accounts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque dijudicari posset, uter utri virtute anteferendus videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n13949.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to decide by arms</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dijudicatā belli fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordiae civium ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13949.3" n="II" level="1"> With the idea of the particle predominating, <hi rend="ital">to discern by judging; to distinguish</hi> (between two): <cit><quote lang="la">vera et falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recta ac prava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus et injuriam, honesta ac turpia (shortly before: legem bonam a mala dividere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem verum et fictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolum et simulatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 10" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: vera a falsis, veri similia ab incredibilibus (with distinguere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 40, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter has sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which simply: sententias subtilissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dijudicandum est, immodicum sit an grande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dijugatio: <entryFree id="n13950" type="hapax" key="di_ju^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dījŭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dijugo</etym>, <sense id="n13950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dijugo: <entryFree id="n13951" type="main" key="di_ju^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-jŭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">disj-</orth>), no <sense id="n13951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to separate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab aliquo (with dijunxit),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dijunctim: <entryFree id="n13952" type="main" key="di_junctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dījunctim, dījunctio</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dījunctus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dījungo</orth>, v. disj.</entryFree>
dilabidus: <entryFree id="n13953" type="hapax" key="di_la_bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlābĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dilabor</etym>, <sense id="n13953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that</hi> <cb n="DILA" /> <hi rend="ital">soon goes to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilabor: <entryFree id="n13954" type="main" key="di_la_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to fall asunder, go to pieces, melt away, dissolve</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13954.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13954.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies liquefacta et dilapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulcanus (i. e. ignis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of a river, <hi rend="ital">to flow apart, flow away</hi>, hoc quasi rostro finditur Fibrenus, et divisus aequaliter ... rapideque dilapsus cito in unum confluit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis presso in solum alveo dilabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. Mütz. ad h. 1.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungula in quinos dilapsa ungues,</quote> <trans><tr>divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Proteus) in aquas tenues dilapsus abibit,</quote> <trans><tr>melting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 410</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13954.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13954.4" n="1" level="3"> In the historians, of persons, esp. of soldiers, <hi rend="ital">to move away in different directions, to flee, escape, scatter, disperse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus amisso duce brevi dilabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 3</bibl></cit>;
