<cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <trans><tr>absol</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 57, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:1:18 al" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 1, 18 al.</bibl>— With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 20</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">e</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 46, 4</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 8, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:6:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo,</quote> <trans><tr>desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 13, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13954.5" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to tumble down</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fall to pieces, go to decay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta virum dilapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 312</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of buildings,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">navis putris vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 557</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax in cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n13954.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to go to decay, go to ruin, perish, be lost</hi>: male parta male dilabuntur, like our <hi rend="ital">light come, light go</hi>, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27</bibl> (for which, disperire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 22</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ne omnia dilabantur, si unum aliquod effugerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclarissime constituta, respublica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae, vis corporis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res maxumae (opp. crescere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis invidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to slip away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia publica negligentiā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to fall into confusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae inter nova gaudia,</quote> <trans><tr>to vanish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt alii plures fortasse, sed meā memoriā dilabuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>vanish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13954.7" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to glide away, pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilapso tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 36, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilaceratio: <entryFree id="n13955" type="main" key="di_la^ce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlăcĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dilacero</etym>, <sense id="n13955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing apart, tearing to pieces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Nahum, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilacero: <entryFree id="n13956" type="main" key="di_la^ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lăcĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear to pieces, to tear apart</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n13956.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: dilaceranda feris dabor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 152</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum (canes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebre corpus tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid (spiculā),</quote> <trans><tr>to lacerate, wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13956.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum integrum ad dilacerandam rem publicam quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica dilacerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 5</bibl></cit> Kritz. (prob. an imitation of Thuc. 3, 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">malis consultis animus dilaceratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl></cit> Loers.: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dilaceravisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit> Fleck.; others, delac-).</sense></entryFree>
dilamino: <entryFree id="n13957" type="hapax" key="di_la_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lāmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lamina</etym>, <sense id="n13957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to split in two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilancinatus: <entryFree id="n13958" type="main" key="di_lanci^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lancĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [lancino], <sense id="n13958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torn to pieces, torn apart</hi> (late Lat.): membra, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 155: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilanio: <entryFree id="n13959" type="main" key="di_la^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lănĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear to pieces, to dilacerate</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Clodii cadaver) canibus dilaniandum reliquisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13</bibl></cit>; cf. id. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 645</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 39 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam (c. c. dispergere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 538</bibl></cit>.—In a Gr. construction: <cit><quote lang="la">dilaniata comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilapidatio: <entryFree id="n13960" type="hapax" key="di_la^pi^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlăpĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dilapido</etym>, <sense id="n13960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a squandering, wasting</hi>: bonorum, Cod. Th. 4, 20, 1.</sense></entryFree>
dilapido: <entryFree id="n13961" type="main" key="di_la^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lăpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, lit., to scatter like stones; hence, <sense id="n13961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw away, squander, to consume</hi> (very rare): nostras triginta minas,<cb n="DILE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 7, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">facultates, Firm. Math. 6, 10: grandine hominumque boumque labores,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:330" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 330</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilapsio: <entryFree id="n13962" type="hapax" key="di_lapsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlapsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dilabor</etym>, <sense id="n13962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">decay, destruction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 22:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 22, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilapsus: <entryFree id="n13963" type="main" key="di_lapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dilabor.</entryFree>
dilargior: <entryFree id="n13964" type="main" key="di_largi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-largĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n13964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to give away</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bestow liberally; to lavish</hi> (very rare): aliquid alicui, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam Magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera sociis, Latium (i. e. jus Latii) externis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 55</bibl></cit>.!*? In pass. signif.: aerarium dilargitur populo Romano, C. Gracchus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.: dilargitis proscriptorum bonis, Sall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 8</bibl> (Hist. 1, 31 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">dilargitis quae amant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilatatio: <entryFree id="n13965" type="main" key="di_la_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dilato</etym>, <sense id="n13965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extending, enlarging</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">laminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Praescr. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilatator: <entryFree id="n13966" type="main" key="di_la_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who propagates, a propagator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinae linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilatio: <entryFree id="n13967" type="main" key="di_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>differo, B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n13967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting off, delaying, deferring</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n13967.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes">45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n13967.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (consul) nullam dilationem patiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 57</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sen. de Ira, 3, 12: solatium dilationis et morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:25:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 25, 17 al.</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:79" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 79</bibl>, al.—Esp. law t. t., <hi rend="ital">the adjournment</hi> of a legal hearing or judgment: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius, interpellatis judicibus, dilationem petiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13967.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The interval</hi>: spatiosa, Apul. M. 11, p. 262, 28.</sense></entryFree>
dilato: <entryFree id="n13968" type="main" key="di_la_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlāto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>differo</etym>. <sense id="n13968.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to spread out, dilate; to enlarge, amplify, extend</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n13968.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(stomachi) partes eae, quae sunt infra, dilatantur, quae autem supra, contrahuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum (opp. comprimere digitos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globum farinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 107</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 46</bibl></cit> (opp. coartatio plurium): <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 42, § 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patulos rictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 141</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13968.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aut ex verbis dilatetur, aut in verbum contrahatur oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum, id. Parad. prooem. § 2: haec, quae dilatantur a nobis, Zeno sic premebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia dilatata (opp. contracta et astricta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:309" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <trans><tr>to pronounce broadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 74, 259</bibl></cit>: nomen in continentibus terris, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 274, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantis in angustiis vestra se gloria dilatari velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">se (c. c. attollere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec lex, dilatata in ordinem cunctum, coangustari etiam potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n13968.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to extend one's self</hi> ( = expandor): <cit><quote lang="la">spatia montis in cubiculo dilatantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit> Sill. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dilator: <entryFree id="n13969" type="main" key="di_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>differo, B. 3.</etym>, <sense id="n13969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delayer, a dilatory person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilatorius: <entryFree id="n13970" type="main" key="di_la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delaying, dilatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptiones (opp. peremptoriae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilatura: <entryFree id="n13971" type="main" key="di_la_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a postponement, delay</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">si unius diei dilaturam fecissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilatus: <entryFree id="n13972" type="main" key="di_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from differo.</entryFree>
dilaudo: <entryFree id="n13973" type="main" key="di_laudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-laudo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n13973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to praise in all respects, to praise very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit> (v. Orell. ad h. l.); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilaxo: <entryFree id="n13974" type="hapax" key="di_laxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-laxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to stretch apart</hi>: cruribu' crura dilaxat, Lucil. ap. Porph. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilectio: <entryFree id="n13975" type="main" key="di_lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diligo</etym>, <sense id="n13975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">love</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:108:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 108, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
dilector: <entryFree id="n13976" type="main" key="di_lector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lover</hi> (postclass.), App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 9, p. 347; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilectus: <entryFree id="n13977" type="main" key="di_lectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from diligo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n13978" type="main" key="di_lectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. delectus.</entryFree>
dilemma: <entryFree id="n13979" type="main" key="di^lemma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭlemma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">di/lhmma</foreign>), <sense id="n13979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double proposition, a dilemma;</hi> in logic, <hi rend="ital">an argument<pb n="580" /> <cb n="DILI" />  in which an adversary is pinned between two difficulties</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 675</bibl>, and 10, 449.</sense></entryFree>
diligens: <entryFree id="n13980" type="main" key="di_li^gens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <sense id="n13980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a., diligent, careful</hi>, etc., v. diligo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diligenter: <entryFree id="n13981" type="main" key="di_li^genter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlĭgenter</orth>, <sense id="n13981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., attentively, carefully, diligently, earnestly;</hi> v. diligo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diligentia: <entryFree id="n13982" type="main" key="di_li^genti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlĭgentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diligens</etym>, <sense id="n13982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carefulness, attentiveness, earnestness, diligence</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: labor, aerumna, opera, industria, assiduitas, sedulitas, studium, cura). </sense><sense id="n13982.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: reliqua sunt in cura, attentione animi, cogitatione, vigilantia, assiduitate, labore; <cit><quote lang="la">complectar uno verbo, quo saepe jam usi sumus, diligentia, qua una virtute omnes virtutes reliquae continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 150</bibl></cit> (v. the whole chapter in connection). </sense><sense id="n13982.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">praepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro mea summa in re publica diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in controversia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:117" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentia tua in retractandis operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa proprietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: circa istum lacum, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erga pecuniam alienam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam adhibere ad rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; 16, 9, 4; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13982.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 60</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 20, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">obscura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium sollicita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:6" default="NO">12, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13982.4" n="(g)" level="5"> Rarely with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: sacrorum, <hi rend="ital">the care of</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis commoditatisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandatorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis illa divisionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>affection for us</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecclesiae Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13982.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">carefulness in household affairs</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">economy, frugality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">maritorum inefficaces diligentiae,</quote> <trans><tr>precautions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diligibilis: <entryFree id="n13983" type="main" key="di_li^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlĭgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diligo</etym>, <sense id="n13983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">estimable, amiable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Phil. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diligo: <entryFree id="n13984" type="main" key="di_li^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>lexi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. lego</etym>. Prop., to distinguish one by selecting him from others; hence, in gen., <sense id="n13984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to value</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem highly, to love</hi> (v. amo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, and cf. faveo, studeo, foveo, cupio; very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13984.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est enim virtute amabilius, nihil quod magis alliciat ad diligendum: quippe cum propter virtutem et probitatem etiam eos, quos numquam vidimus, quodam modo diligamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 29</bibl> sq.; 14, 50; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 12</bibl> et saep. (cf. also the passages with diligo which are cited under amo, 1. and 1. colo, II. 2. b.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 61, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">satin habes, si feminarum nulla'st, quam aeque diligam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 344</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:62 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 62 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in germani fratris dilexi loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24 al.</bibl>: quem di diligunt, <hi rend="ital">whom the gods favor</hi>, denoting a fortunate person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 14</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">diligitur nemo, nisi cui fortuna secunda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n13984.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13984.3" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem est complexus, observantiamque dilexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris consilia in re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentiam, diligentiam, prudentiam mirifice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviae memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auream mediocritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cypron,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 2</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n13984.4" n="B" level="2"> Very rarely, of inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to love, choose, affect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes amant cedrus, larix, etc.... montes et valles diligit abies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:73 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 73 sq.</bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n13984.5" n="C" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> for amare, <hi rend="ital">to do willingly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habitually, to be fond of</hi> doing: <cit><quote lang="la">pira nasci tali solo maxime diligunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13984.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lĭgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, prop. esteeming, loving; hence, in respect to an inanimate object, <hi rend="ital">careful, assiduous, attentive, diligent, accurate</hi> with regard to it, opp. negligens (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13984.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n13984.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">praepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in re adventitia atque hereditaria tam diligens, tam attentus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; so, in rebus omnibus,<cb n="DILU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exquirendis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ostentis animadvertendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in compositione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 10, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in philosophia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eloquendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in symmetria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 58 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad custodiendum aliquem diligentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad reportandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentes circa hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 5, 30, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa aerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13984.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis officii diligentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:30:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 30, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Con. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum veterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliarum rerum quae vitam instruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:79:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 79, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <trans><tr>attentively investigating it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 3, 13, § 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n13984.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthios video publicis equis assignandis et alendis, orborum et viduarum tributis fuisse quondam diligentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13984.11" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">experientissimus ac diligentissimus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: pro cauto ac diligente, Caes. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 101</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ut a diligenti curiosus distat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:10" default="NO">2, 15, 10</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13984.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua ac diligens scriptura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentior notitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13984.13" n="C" level="2"> In partic., with reference to domestic affairs, <hi rend="ital">frugal, thrifty, economical</hi> (cf. its opp. negligens = prodigus, and Ruhnk. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:page=95" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> p. 95</bibl>, a, ed. Frotsch.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo frugi ac diligens, qui sua servare vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. negligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and c. c. parcus and opp. luxuriosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te pro illiberali diligentem (appelles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex re familiari, cujus diligentissimus erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlĭgenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to II. A.), <hi rend="ital">carefully, attentively, diligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accurate agatur, docte et diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 47 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl> A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:22:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 22, 30 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:81 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 81 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13984.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., loved, beloved, dear</hi> (rare).—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri dilecti Superis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 153</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:395" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 395</bibl>; 8, 758.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 6, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce mihi carior dilectior fili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 74 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o( e)rw/menos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a favorite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilogia: <entryFree id="n13985" type="main" key="di^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">dilogi/a</foreign>), <sense id="n13985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ambiguity</hi>, as a rhetorical figure, Pseud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 1:9:26" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 1, 9, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dilophos: <entryFree id="n13986" type="greek" key="di^lo^phos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭlŏphos</orth>, <itype>a, on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/lofos</foreign>, <sense id="n13986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with two crests, two-crested</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilorico: <entryFree id="n13987" type="main" key="di_lo_ri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lōrīco</orth>, no <sense id="n13987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear apart, tear open</hi> one's dress (very rare): tunicam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 191.</sense></entryFree>
diloris: <entryFree id="n13988" type="greek" key="di^lo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭlōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibrida, from <foreign lang="greek">di/s</foreign> and lorum, double-thonged, i. e.</etym>, <sense id="n13988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doublestriped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bonos. 15, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diluceo: <entryFree id="n13989" type="main" key="di_lu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, lit., to be light enough to distinguish objects apart; hence, trop., <sense id="n13989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be clear, evident</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dilucere brevi fraus coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 29</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emolumentum ejus in animo tuo dilucebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—With a subject-clause: <cit><quote lang="la">satis dilucet, hanc capionem posse dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilucesco: <entryFree id="n13990" type="main" key="di_lu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcesco</orth>, <itype>luxi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [diluceo], <hi rend="ital">to grow light, to begin to shine, to dawn;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">perf., to shine</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13990.1" n="I" level="1"> Impers.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam dilucesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dilucescebat, cum signum consul dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so transf.: discussa est illa caligo ... diluxit, patet, videmus omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13990.2" n="II" level="1"> Pers.: omnem crede diem tibi diluxisse supremum, etc., * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 2</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec diluxit rerum genetalis origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista dilucescant allucente misericordiā tuā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 11, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dilucidatio: <entryFree id="n13991" type="main" key="di_lu_ci^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dilucido</etym>, <sense id="n13991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an illustrating,<cb n="DILU" />  explaining; clearness, distinctness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex. 1</bibl> Cor. 6.</sense></entryFree>
dilucide: <entryFree id="n13992" type="main" key="di_lu_ci^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcĭdē</orth>, <sense id="n13992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., clearly, brightly; plainly, evidently, distinctly;</hi> v. dilucidus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dilucidus: <entryFree id="n13993" type="main" key="di_lu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diluceo</etym>, <sense id="n13993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear, bright</hi> (syn.: clarus, illustris, perspicuus, conspicuus). </sense><sense id="n13993.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">zmaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13993.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">clear, plain, distinct, evident</hi> (in Cic. and Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">26: sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO">11, 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">enuntiatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia dilucidiora non ampliora facientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi> does not occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcĭdē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n13993.3" n="a" level="4"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.) <hi rend="ital">Clearly, brightly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilucidius flagrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 12, § 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13993.4" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.) <hi rend="ital">Plainly, evidently, distinctly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dilucide planeque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei dilucide magnificandi causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex vetat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Vat. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Hier. Ep. 29:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Hier. Ep. 29, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diluculat: <entryFree id="n13994" type="main" key="di_lu_cu^lat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcŭlat</orth>, <itype>ābat, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> [diluculum], <hi rend="ital">it grows light, it dawns;</hi> perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:1:6" default="NO">7, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diluculum: <entryFree id="n13995" type="main" key="di_lu_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlūcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>diluceo</etym>, <sense id="n13995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daybreak, dawn</hi> (cf. crepusculum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl>, a; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 1</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Anton. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Anton. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diludium: <entryFree id="n13996" type="hapax" key="di_lu_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lūdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ludus</etym>, <sense id="n13996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restingtime, intermission</hi> between plays, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diluo: <entryFree id="n13997" type="main" key="di_lu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to wash to pieces, wash away; to dissolve, dilute, cause to melt away; to wash, drench</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13997.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13997.2" n="A" level="2"> Ingen.: ne aqua lateres diluere posset, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata laeta boumque labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 326</bibl></cit>; cf.: sanguine diluitur tellus, <hi rend="ital">is soaked</hi>, Furius Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 9, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum helleboro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus cruris aceto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus ovi albore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 24" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to wash out, weaken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes diluuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 4, 29, § 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13997.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to dissolve</hi> any thing in a liquid, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to temper, dilute, mix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:930" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 930</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">helleborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:100" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dilute with water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:107" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 107</bibl></cit>; v. under <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">favos lacte et miti Baccho (i. e. vino),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 344</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymettia mella Falerno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignem bacam aceto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 158" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:261 al" default="NO">261 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circaeam in vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 38, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rutam cum mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum ex aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 247" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 247</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n13997.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13997.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To weaken, lessen, impair; to do away with, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversariorum confirmatio diluitur aut infirmatur aut elevatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res leves infirmare ac diluere (opp. confirmare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestias omnes (c. c. extenuare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curam multo mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seriorem horam mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium ex animo (Bacchus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 16, 6 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 12</bibl> (opp. obicere); 9, 2, 53 (c. c. negare) et saep.; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 695</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam aliqua cavillatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias aere pauco,</quote> <trans><tr>to atone for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes affectuum vires, Quint, 11, 1, 52: ejus auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam tam praeclarae rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13997.6" n="B" level="2"> Analog. with its synon. dissolvere, <hi rend="ital">to solve</hi> a difficulty, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to explain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi, quod rogavi, dilue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 64</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
